story:
Final Update for 

Night Shift Therapy 

Positional Therapy for Obstructive Sleep Apnea


Although the campaign has ended, we are happy to announce that Night Shift Therapy is now FDA Cleared for prescription use and available at NightShiftTherapy.com


Many thanks to ALL of our supporters and contributors world wide!



Improve Your Sleep Quality with Position Therapy!

Participate to discover whether

  • Your snoring and sleep apnea improves as a result of Night Shift use
  • You are inspired to use it every night or almost every night
  • You find benefit in access to sleep quality, snoring, and response-to-therapy information
  • Your changes in symptoms and sleep quality are similar to others in the study
  • Your health insurance pays for the cost of your participation


Why Participate

Snoring and sleep apnea are signs of an abnormal, collapsing upper airway. Snoring and sleep apnea not only affect your health, but they also impact your bed-partner’s happiness. A non-snorer in a marriage loses about an hour of sleep each night, while snoring is reportedly the number one medical cause for divorce.

Sleep apnea and snoring are common in both men and women; almost 100% of those with sleep apnea snore. Sleep apnea causes fragmentation of sleep and inadequate oxygenation of the brain, heart, and other tissues.

Consequences of Sleep Apnea

Over 70% of those with sleep apnea are at least twice as severe while sleeping on their back (positional sleep apnea), and as many as 65% of non-apneic snorers snore loudest while on their back (positional snorer).

Positional Solution

Night Shift is a medical device designed to treat positional snoring and sleep apnea. Worn on the back of the neck, it is secured in place with a medical grade silicone strap and magnetic clasp. Night Shift begins to gently vibrate when you start to sleep on your back. The vibration slowly increases in intensity until you change positions.

Night Shift is also an intelligent, interactive monitor that measures sleep quality and the frequency of unhealthy loud snoring. The internet-based Report Portal enables you to monitor the effectiveness of the therapy and its improvements on your sleep quality.

The Night Shift technology allows you to confirm you are being effectively treated for sleep apnea and snoring. Use the Monthly and Daily Night Shift Reports to:

  • Monitor how efficiently you sleep and the degree of your sleep fragmentation
  • Evaluate the influence of alcohol on your loud snoring
  • Assess the association between loud snoring and sleep quality
  • Determine if your snoring and poor sleep quality is limited to back-sleeping
  • Track how often you try to sleep on your back and how quickly you respond to Night Shift position therapy
  • Compare the effectiveness of other sleep apnea or snoring therapies with and without position therapy

Click on the link to an independent evaluation of Night Shift at www.snorer.com:

Clinically Proven

In one of our studies, 30 patients with positional sleep apnea completed a questionnaire to assess their symptoms and then underwent an overnight sleep study in a sleep laboratory. They wore the Night Shift every night for four weeks and used the Report Portal to monitor their progress. After participants were studied a second time, results showed:

We also found that Night Shift was up to two-times more accurate than activity trackers and cell phone applications that provided published sleep detection results.

How to Participate

We are using crowdfunding to recruit Night Shift users for a six-month study. Your study results will be included in a private, confidential patient database used to predict those most likely to benefit from the Night Shift therapy. Based on your feedback we will design more effective Night Shift reports. If you are between the ages of 18 and 90 years old and are NOT happily using CPAP for at least five hours a night, every night, you are eligible to participate in our study.

Join the first crowdfunding campaign to -

  • Conduct a National Institutes of Health registered study
  • Evaluate a prescription therapy
  • Incorporate medical reimbursement
  • Encourage the diagnosis and treatment of sleep apnea

Benefit from your contribution with -

  • Early access to the Night Shift at the reduced study price
  • Unlimited access to the internet-based Report Portal and all of its capabilities
  • A prescription so you can keep the Night Shift when you complete the study
  • An individualized study report that compares changes in your sleep health and symptoms after 3- and 6-months, as well as your changes to those in your gender and age-matched group and all study participants

When you join the campaign, you need to follow these three easy steps to successfully complete the 6-month study -

  STEP 1: Complete the online consent form and two questionnaires 

  STEP 2: Wear Night Shift as often as possible; ideally every night 

  STEP 3: Complete 2 online questionnaires & print a Night Shift report after 3- and 6-months.

Contribute to the design of the next generation Night Shift -
  • Define the Night Shift statistics are most relevant to you
  • Vote on your preference for the new report formats
  • Value the benefit of Night Shift mobile applications

Additional Benefits 

By enrolling in our study, we will additionally assist you in optionally obtaining:
  • Insurance reimbursement for the Night Shift
  • A reimbursed home sleep test to evaluate whether you have sleep apnea
  • A reimbursed home sleep test to confirm you are being effectively treated by Night Shift

Use the table below to help evaluate your Night Shift reimbursement and/or sleep study choices:

Timeline

Who We Are

We are Advanced Brain Monitoring, and over the past 15 years, our team of scientists, physicians, and engineers has challenged conventional thinking by developing innovative medical devices that provide a superior patient experience, lower healthcare costs, and improved quality of care. Among our achievements:

  • Our medical devices have been used on over 200,000 patients world-wide
  • Our innovations have resulted in 20 patents and 12 patents-pending
  • We have been awarded over 40 research grants from National Institute of Health, Department of Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), and other government agencies
  • Our clinical studies have included over 5,000 participants which resulted in over 100 scientific publications

Why We Need You

We are a small company with BIG ideas, and we need your help to spread the word. Your contribution and participation will allow us to:

  • Increase production of Night Shift devices to meet anticipated demand
  • Create user-recommended features and improvements
  • Establish coverage by insurance for future users
  • Boost visibility and awareness so more people can be helped
  • Put lighter, stronger, reusable packaging into production
  • Change the way Sleep Apnea patients are treated for their condition

We strongly believe this therapy will dramatically increase the quality of life for many Sleep Apnea sufferers and snorers. Your participation and/or contribution will play a large role in helping them, and those around them, feel better faster. 

Participation Options

FAQ

Q1. Can I keep the Night Shift after the conclusion of the study?
A. Yes. You can keep your Night Shift if you obtain a prescription from your physician. Or we can assist you in obtaining a prescription when you complete the study.

Q2. Will my health insurance cover the cost of the Night Shift?
A. If you provide us: a) your sleep study report that shows your overall severity is at least 5 events/hour, b) a prescription from your physician, and c) your medical billing information, we will assist you with reimbursement. If you have PPO insurance, the reimbursement amount (which will be returned to you) may cover up to 100% of your Health Tracker contribution. Click here to learn more about reimbursement.

Q3. What if I don’t use Night Shift every night?
A. There is no requirement to use Night Shift every night. A goal of this study is to evaluate how consistently users wear the Night Shift.

Q4. What if I want to stop using Night Shift?
A. Even if you stop using Night Shift, you need to generate a Report at the end of 3-months and 6-months to complete the study.

Q5. Why must I sign a Consent Form?
A. A consent form is required to participate in a study. Signing the consent form informs you of the risks and your rights as a participant.

Q6. What are the risks of using Night Shift?
A. The greatest risk (as described in the Consent Form) is that you assume Night Shift is treating your sleep apnea but it is not.  We strongly recommend and provide assistance for you to undergo a follow-up sleep study to mitigate this concern.

Q7. How do I know if I am a good candidate for Night Shift Therapy?
A. If you were previously diagnosed with Sleep Apnea you are a good candidate for Night Shift Therapy if:

  • Your sleep study report shows your “supine” sleep apnea severity is two times your severity when you don’t sleep on your back (i.e., supine apnea hypopnea index (AHI) is twice as high as your non-supine AHI)
  • Your overall AHI severity is less than 30 if the supine AHI is not provided

Q8. Who is NOT a good candidate for Night Shift Therapy?
A. If you have been diagnosed with sleep apnea and your overall AHI is greater than 60 or if you are not certain you have positional sleep apnea (please consult with your physician before enrolling).

Q9. What health conditions limit me from using the device?
A. We recommend that Night Shift is not used on patients who:

  • suffer from tics or tremors of the head
  • suffer from cardiac arrhythmia corrected by an artificial pace-maker
  • have neck less than 12 inches (30 cm) or greater than 22 inches (55 cm)
  • are currently suffering from neck, shoulder, or back pain
  • have an open cut or wound near the neck (you may need to temporarily discontinue use)

Q10. What if I can’t fall asleep unless I am on my back?
A. Night Shift delays the start of therapy for 15 minutes after the device is turned on in order to give you time to fall asleep on your back. If you need more time, you can use the Report Portal to increase the delay to 30 minutes.

Q11. Won’t the delivery of position therapy interrupt my sleep?
A. If you have sleep apnea, you may experience fewer interruptions than you do now. In the previous study of Night Shift for prescription use, both brief arousals, as well as awakenings, were significantly reduced because patients slept more deeply. Users recalled position avoidance therapy on average twice per night, yet they attempted to sleep supine on average seven times per night.

Q12. What do I have to do to maintain the Night Shift?
A. Night Shift should be charged before use. We include a cable that is compatible with a USB charger. The device must be recharged at least once every three days. When it is turned on, it vibrates to indicate the number of nights it can be worn before it must be recharged. It will also indicate when the battery is too low to provide therapy for 8 hours. We recommend that the strap is washed in dish soap and the enclosure wiped with alcohol routinely to keep it clean.

Q13. How do I know whether I have sleep apnea or am simply a snorer?
A. The only way to determine this is to have a sleep study. We can assist you in obtaining a home sleep study or you can obtain a referral from your physician to a sleep study provider. In most cases, the cost of the sleep study will be covered by medical insurance.

Q14. Can I obtain a Night Shift without participating in the study?
A. Once the study is completed, the Night Shift will become available by prescription. 

Q15. Do you have information about Night Shift that I can share with my physician when I get my prescription? 
A. Yes, we can provide the abstracts and links, when published, to two clinical studies. 

Q16. How do I know the privacy of my health and reimbursement information is protected?
A. To ensure your safety and protect your patient health information, our "Information Technology Plan" has been approved by the National Institute of Health and the consent form and survey were approved by an Independent Review Board.

Q17. Does the Night Shift include a warranty?
A. Yes, Night Shift includes a two-year warranty covering workmanship problems related to the electronics. The battery and haptic motors carry a one-year warranty and can be replaced after one year for a $50 fee. The neck strap should be replaced every six months and will cost $15. Night Shift is medical device that is not water-proof, pet-proof, or mistake-proof. The warranty is void if you do not treat your Night Shift with care.

Q18. If I order a Star Treatment, how will that work?

A.  You will be contacted by email to arrange your pre-treatment sleep study.  A home sleep test device will be shipped to your home or residence.  We recommend you wear the device for two nights to provide the most accurate assessment.  An envelope and return shipping label will be provided with the device. Approximately two weeks after the device is returned, we will email you your results and arrange for your consultation with Dr. Westbrook.  This process will be repeated approximately 3-months after you’ve been using Night Shift

Q19. If I order an Executive Package, how does that work?

A.  You will be contacted by email so you can schedule your trips to Carlsbad.  You will be responsible for your travel expenses. Your comprehensive assessment will begin at 9 AM.  It will include test battery of neuro-psychology tasks with simultaneous acquisition of your brain's electrical activity.  Your session will include mental focus training which we developed for soldiers.  Your session will end around 12:30 PM.  Approximately 3-months after you began your therapy, you will be retested. You will be emailed a comprehensive Alertness, Memory and Executive Function Profile report approximately 3-weeks after your follow-up session.

Final Update for Night Shift Therapy Positional Therapy for Obstructive Sleep Apnea
Although the campaign has ended, we are happy to announce that Night Shift Therapy is now FDA Cleared for prescription use and available at NightShiftTherapy.com

Many thanks to ALL of our supporters and contributors world wide!

Improve Your Sleep Quality with Position Therapy!
Participate to discover whether

Your snoring and sleep apnea improves as a result of Night Shift use
You are inspired to use it every night or almost every night
You find benefit in access to sleep quality, snoring, and response-to-therapy information 
Your changes in symptoms and sleep quality are similar to others in the study
Your health insurance pays for the cost of your participation

Why Participate
Snoring and sleep apnea are signs of an abnormal, collapsing upper airway. Snoring and sleep apnea not only affect your health, but they also impact your bed-partner’s happiness. A non-snorer in a marriage loses about an hour of sleep each night, while snoring is reportedly the number one medical cause for divorce.
Sleep apnea and snoring are common in both men and women; almost 100% of those with sleep apnea snore. Sleep apnea causes fragmentation of sleep and inadequate oxygenation of the brain, heart, and other tissues.
Consequences of Sleep Apnea

Over 70% of those with sleep apnea are at least twice as severe while sleeping on their back (positional sleep apnea), and as many as 65% of non-apneic snorers snore loudest while on their back (positional snorer).
Positional Solution
Night Shift is a medical device designed to treat positional snoring and sleep apnea. Worn on the back of the neck, it is secured in place with a medical grade silicone strap and magnetic clasp. Night Shift begins to gently vibrate when you start to sleep on your back. The vibration slowly increases in intensity until you change positions.
Night Shift is also an intelligent, interactive monitor that measures sleep quality and the frequency of unhealthy loud snoring. The internet-based Report Portal enables you to monitor the effectiveness of the therapy and its improvements on your sleep quality.

The Night Shift technology allows you to confirm you are being effectively treated for sleep apnea and snoring. Use the Monthly and Daily Night Shift Reports to:

Monitor how efficiently you sleep and the degree of your sleep fragmentation
Evaluate the influence of alcohol on your loud snoring
Assess the association between loud snoring and sleep quality
Determine if your snoring and poor sleep quality is limited to back-sleeping
Track how often you try to sleep on your back and how quickly you respond to Night Shift position therapy
Compare the effectiveness of other sleep apnea or snoring therapies with and without position therapy
Click on the link to an independent evaluation of Night Shift at www.snorer.com:

story:
Welcome

Let me start off by introducing myself, my name is Joshua and I appreciate you taking the time to view our campaign. I've been putting in endless hours to turn a seemingly simple project, into a healthy alternative snack that I can share with you! Yes you! But before I get ahead of myself, let me take it back to the beginning a little over 6 months ago. I was inspired by my 2 year old daughter to create a healthy snack that was not only good for her, but that she could enjoy!

Since I can remember I've been an advocate of healthy living. So coming up with a snack for her didn't take me long. She absolutely loves these Gluten/Dairy/Soy/Grain free snacks and so did all her friends!  After a lot of positive feed back from family, friends, co workers and local members of my community. I decided to take it to the next level. That's how Gorilla Grub Co was born.(We are still a start up but we do have the opportunity to hit the ground

 

What sets us apart?

Gorilla Grub CO fuses most of the principles and practices that every company should have or should eventually incorporate. We are green!

Eco-Friendly We virtually have zero waste! Our products main ingredient is bananas. Lucky for us banana peels can serve as a beneficial fertilizer. They are ideal because they break down quickly and contain vital nutrients, that are useful for many plants! The organic compost made from the peels will be shared with organic farmers.

Sustainable Energy Through alternative energy sources(solar/wind) we plan on reducing our carbon foot print dramatically. Tell then we will only use equipment that is energy efficient.

Biodegradable Packaging With help from our local community we can make this company the blueprint for future company's. With every pledge you can rest assured that not only will we be producing healthier foods, we will also be striving towards a better Planet.

Non Profit We are also in process of partnering with a non profit organization. 5% of all our profits will go into helping whatever cause we end up choosing. We have a pledge option for you to help us with our final choice. This will be announced at the end of the campaign.

We currently have two products

Both these products are unique because they are one of a kind banana based chips. With only 5 wholesome organic ingredients;Banana,Tree Nuts,lemon,raw honey,vanilla bean in Monkey Munchies. And 6 ingredients in Gorilla Grub

(added super food hemp seeds).

There is nothing else like these snacks. We are currently working on other flavors as well, you can help us choose these flavors! It's a part of one of the gift packages for pledging.

A few Health Benefits of our chips

potassium-is needed to transport ions between cells — this is a major factor in a healthy  metabolism and good cardiovascular health. Check!

Vitamin E & Good Fats- have cholesterol lowering effects, aid in weight loss. Check!

Magnesium- prevents cardiovascular disease, regulates high blood pressure,treats diabetes,migraines, insomnia, and depression. Check!

Phosphorus- makes up 1% of your body weight, essential for building strong bones and teeth Check!

With your support anything is possible!

So what can you do to help? Back us on IndieGoGo! We have several  great ways that you can help us out. Tell your friends and family about our campaign to help us get the word out.(shout it from the rooftops!)  The more support we receive, gives us more of a chance to get into our own facility, in turn the  more orders we can fulfill. Help us get these products in stores near you. Support a company that cares about everyone and every living thing around them, not just their next dollar.

 

How will your money be spent?

We need to raise money for equipment, finishing certifications, Kitchen space.

EQUIPMENT (55%) -  The majority of your pledges about 55%, will go toward  equipment.  We need our very own  commercial grade ovens(energy efficient), and  commercial mixers.  An industrial size dryer machine and a few miscellaneous kitchen items.  The equipment can be  rather expensive, but we've done our research and know how to get the  most bang for your buck.

REWARDS (25%) - The next largest  portion of your pledges will go toward covering our rewards.  We will be using only premium quality materials & items (material for shirts/stickers/website/gorilla group)may cost a bit more, but we feel it is well worth the additional cost. Only the best for you our Supporters!

KITCHEN SPACE (16%) -  This includes any miscellaneous equipment,  dishes, and furnishings that we may need as well as any permit fees  associated with moving into our own space.(State agriculture Department)(State zoning license's)(Inspection fee's)(health department)

IndieGoGo (4%)- Last 4% will go to Indiegogo for running the campaign.

We have a few locations we are looking at that seem like a good fit. we will narrow down and keep you updated on our final decision.

 

Risks and Challenges

Approved facility or not:
We are looking at spaces that are already State Health Department approved but we have planned to budget around needing to meet the qualifications for a location that has not been approved(plan for the worst hope for the best). We believe that we can setup a space without a lot of major renovations. So this shouldn't be a challenge we cannot overcome quickly and efficiently.

Set Space:
The amount of time the campaign will take in accordance to holding a space that we have been looking at should not be an issue. So we will lock down a space as soon as we know we hit a certain dollar amount of our funding goal. We are assuming this but if any issue arises we will still be able to set up shop for a bit at our local commercial kitchen. That is worst case scenario of course.

Scalability:
Moving from an small commercial kitchen operation to a full-scale business servicing retailers,requires careful planning and controlled growth. On time delivery, customer service and accurate fulfillment will be some of the most significant activities to maintain. We have a team of passionate over achievers, this will not be a risk it will be more of a challenge that we are happy to take on.

Our goal is to have all gifts delivered by the end of December hopefully in time for the holidays! We will absolutely give 150% to make this happen. If that doesn't happen they will be delivered by the estimated date of January 30 2014.

Gift/Rewards

Tshirts 100% hemp fabric

Comes in any size you wish Childrens s/m/l/xl Adult s/m/l/xl/xxl

Sticker Labels!!

Rest of the gifts are self explanatory

Our Journey

 

From concept to reality!

Support a company that cares about everyone and every living thing around them, not just their next dollar. How will your money be spent?We need to raise money for equipment, finishing certifications, Kitchen space.EQUIPMENT (55%) -  The majority of your pledges about 55%, will go toward  equipment.  We need our very own  commercial grade ovens(energy efficient), and  commercial mixers.  An industrial size dryer machine and a few miscellaneous kitchen items.  The equipment can be  rather expensive, but we've done our research and know how to get the  most bang for your buck.REWARDS (25%) - The next largest  portion of your pledges will go toward covering our rewards.  We will be using only premium quality materials & items (material for shirts/stickers/website/gorilla group)may cost a bit more, but we feel it is well worth the additional cost. Only the best for you our Supporters! KITCHEN SPACE (16%) -  This includes any miscellaneous equipment,  dishes, and furnishings that we may need as well as any permit fees  associated with moving into our own space.(State agriculture Department)(State zoning license's)(Inspection fee's)(health department)IndieGoGo (4%)- Last 4% will go to Indiegogo for running the campaign.We have a few locations we are looking at that seem like a good fit. we will narrow down and keep you updated on our final decision. Risks and ChallengesApproved facility or not:We are looking at spaces that are already State Health Department approved but we have planned to budget around needing to meet the qualifications for a location that has not been approved(plan for the worst hope for the best). We believe that we can setup a space without a lot of major renovations. So this shouldn't be a challenge we cannot overcome quickly and efficiently.Set Space:The amount of time the campaign will take in accordance to holding a space that we have been looking at should not be an issue. So we will lock down a space as soon as we know we hit a certain dollar amount of our funding goal. We are assuming this but if any issue arises we will still be able to set up shop for a bit at our local commercial kitchen. That is worst case scenario of course.Scalability:Moving from an small commercial kitchen operation to a full-scale business servicing retailers,requires careful planning and controlled growth. On time delivery, customer service and accurate fulfillment will be some of the most significant activities to maintain. We have a team of passionate over achievers, this will not be a risk it will be more of a challenge that we are happy to take on. Our goal is to have all gifts delivered by the end of December hopefully in time for the holidays! We will absolutely give 150% to make this happen. If that doesn't happen they will be delivered by the estimated date of January 30 2014.Gift/RewardsTshirts 100% hemp fabricComes in any size you wish Childrens s/m/l/xl Adult s/m/l/xl/xxlSticker Labels!!Rest of the gifts are self explanatoryOur Journey From concept to reality!

story:
Nuestra Historia

Estimados amigos, compañeros y seguidores de Gregory Berríos. Acudimos a ustedes para solicitarles su apoyo y ayuda para su defensa en el caso que ha presentado la WADA en su contra. Recibió una comunicación que para el 24 de marzo tiene que ir a Suiza a la vista de defensa. Para esa fecha tiene que levantar $6,000 dólares para cubrir gastos legales y generales. Les escribo para solicitar dentro de lo posible su ayuda monetaria.


En la actualidad, él no esta generando ingresos ya que no le permiten jugar y por tal razón a perdido su contrato en Puerto Rico así como en Francia. Esto le ha creado una situación económica caótica por lo cual hemos tenido que recurrir a ustedes para su ayuda.


Esta vista es para demostrar su inocencia ya que todas las pruebas han sido enviadas y ellos le han citado para esta vista. Todo aquel que desee cooperar se pueden comunicar con nosotros a través de Facebook o mi cel. 787-447-5980 (Ivette) o 787-309-1382 (Yoliann).


Agradecemos pase este comunicado a sus contactos. Gracias por todo su apoyo y su ayuda. Necesitamos sus oraciones para que podamos tener a Gregory nuevamente en nuestras canchas y en nuestro equipo nacional.


Gracias!

Ivette Torres (Familia Berríos)


--------

Our Story


Dear friends, family and followers of Gregory Berrios. We came to you asking for your help in defense for the case WADA filed against him. A received communication, he will need to go to Switzerland in a defense trial on March 24. He need to raise $6,000 to cover legal and general fees. I am writing to request as much as possible to help him.

Currently, he is not generating revenue, he has lost his contract in France and Puerto Rico creating a chaotic economic situation for him so we turned to you for your help.

This trial is to prove his innocence and that all the evidence has been sent. They have cited for this trial. Anyone willing to cooperate can give as much as you can and/or communicate with us via Facebook or my cellphone 787-447-5980 (Ivette) or 787-309-1382 (Yoliann).

Thanks for all your support and help. We need your prays so we can get Gregory back into our courts and our national team.

Thanks a lot!

Ivette Torres (Berrios's Family)

story:
On February 17, 2013, Nick Francescutti was in a snowmobiling accident while vacationing in the Adirondack Mountains.  After a long rescue effort, Nick was airlifted to Fletcher Allen hospital in Burlington, VT.  While his injuries were extremely serious, Nick’s recovery has astonished his family, friends, and doctors up to this point. 

Nick’s will to improve has been amazing.  In the accident, he sustained injuries that most wouldn’t survive including a broken neck, the partial loss of his leg, and other serious, but less severe injuries.  Though he has overcome so much in such a short time already, Nick has a great deal of recovery and hurdles to overcome in his future.  

As a member of the United States Border Patrol, Nick is a person of amazing character, integrity and possesses kindness that most could only hope for.  Nick joined the patrol immediately after college and has been protecting and serving our nation on both the Southern and Northern United States borders ever since.

To help Nick with his recovery effort we are reaching out to anyone willing to donate.  All donations will go directly to Nick’s recovery to help with upcoming medical expenses and needs. Our goal is $1000 and hopefully, with everyone’s support and help we can reach it!  

Please contribute what you can to help Nick! NO DONATION IS TOO SMALL...Whether you have $5 to spare or $100, ANYTHING HELPS!

story:
My name is LeeAnn Harris I launched this campaign to help my best friend Severina Turner and her family. If I was in a place to help her myself I would, but I can't so I am asking you to help do what I cannot.

     On June 19th Severina woke up with a stomach ache, she thought it was something she ate and didnt think anything of it. After napping most of the day to try and feel better the pain was pretty bad and her boyfriend Josh took her to the ER. They took her blood pressure and immediatly admitted her. She had developed pre-eclampsia, which is basically extremely high blood pressure that can cut off blood flow to the baby. The hospital tried to stop it but they ended up taking Seve to an emergency C-section at only 25 weeks pregnant.

    Adelee Kay Poppe was born that night and weighed 1lb 2.9 oz. against all odds she had no major issues and has been showing her strength ever since. Doctors and nurses were impressed with her progess and lack of problems that most premature babies her size ususally go through. During her 3 month stay at Benefis Hospital she had one minor blood infection and was on oxygen only to supplement her breathing because she was so small but was breathing on her own. They sent Adelee home to be with Seve, Josh, and her big sister Tabitha on September 11th, she was almost 5lbs by then.

   Everything was going well the first week home on September 17th Seve was holding Adelee in her nursery when Adelee went limp and quit breathing. Seve's mom called 911 while Seve performed CPR on her daughter until the paramedics arrived and were able to revive her on the way to the hospital. Once they revived her, Adelee went back to being a healthy and happy baby so after a few days and nothing popping up on tests and scans they sent her home again. A few days later on September 25th Adelee felt cold and wasn't eating well so Seve and Josh took her to the ER as a precaution and as they walked into the hospital Adelee quit breathing and went limp again. Once the doctors revived her was fine but she did test for RSV, which can be fatal for preemies so they kept her for a few more days and she was doing fine so they sent her home again.

  On October 5th Seve noticed Adelee was being lethargic again so she took her to the pediatrician and they were admitted to the hospital again. Her little lungs had taken a hit from the RSV and she wasn't getting rid of the Co2 in her lungs on her own.

   Adelee has been transported to Seattle and is currently sedated and paralyzed because the new ventilator she is on vibrates her gently to help get the Co2 out of her lungs. Also being sedated allows her body to focus on healing since she was working so hard the right side of her heart has become enlarged from working overtime. There is no name or condition so far for what is going with Adelee.

  This is where I am asking for your help. Seve and Josh were in the process of buying a house when Adelee was born and have worked to make it a home for their family. Seve works at Chillis in Great Falls and went back to work while Adelee was in the hospital after being born then took her maternity leave when Adelee was sent home the first time, while Josh continued working. Obviously this is not the typical maternity leave and it can be hard for any family to lose an income for awhile but to go through this and have the stress of bills and a new house shouldn't be something that they have to worry about. I am asking for your help to raise $3000 to help these wonderful people be able to concentrate on their daughter and not how quickly they will have to go back to work.

  I hope you can find it in your heart to help and those of you who know this family know that it is going to good people who deserve some help during a difficult time.

story:
Our Kickstarter project that was over funded funded by 328% 

Now Available on Amazon


Facebook



Inversion Therapy 

The sole act of hanging upside down on the sling unloads the spine: thus relieving pressure on nerve roots due to poor postural habits, lack of proper stretching & exercise and the effects of gravity and our own body weight. Inversion alleviates muscle tension, neck & back pain, promotes increased joint mobility, flexibility, relaxation and increased circulation of blood, lymph & energy. It is an incredible anti-stress and anti-aging practice – we like to call it a “natural botox.”

The Yogena™ suspension system is an inversion sling that allows you to suspend in an inverted position with your pelvis and leg muscles bearing your body weight. This position eliminates all gravitational compression. Inversion therapy is the safest, quickest and most effective way to increase the space between your vertebrae. Numerous clinical studies published in reputable medical journals have confirmed that inversion really does increase the separation between the discs of the spine, which brings relief from back pain. 

Benefits of Inversion Therapy

Suspension Yoga

Suspension Yoga uses an inversion sling as a prop to help achieve the traditional Yoga asnas, the weight of the body being either partially or fully supported by the inversion hammock.


What is the Yogena Inversion Sling?






The Yogena Inversion Sling is a patent pending (USPTO Application # 61/853,846) recreational hammock & inversion sling that can be used as a yoga prop, a suspension trainer and can be used indoors or outdoors. The hammock weights only 5 lbs, comes with its own bag and can be set up in less than 2 minutes on any support beam or two points that are strong enough to hold your weight. The hammock is made from parachute nylon and polyester webbing and can hold up to 700 lbs.

It comes with 4 carabiners (strength 12 kN or 2,697 lbs each) and includes 2 daisy chains (4.5 feet each) with 22 pockets.The actual length of the hammock fabric is 92 inches and width is 48 inches. It can comfortably accommodate one person; however, we have also put two people in the hammock and it was ok.

There are plastic adjusters on both sides of the hammock that can be used to adjust the availability of fabric and as such, the hammock can be used as a yoga prop for suspension yoga and spinal decompression. The user can invert 180 degrees in 3 easy steps using the handles to support the user's body weight while inverting.

All it needs are 2 suspension points strong enough to hold your weight. As such, it can be used from monkey bars, tree branches, exposed beams and pretty much everywhere you can suspend it from.

Future Plans

We would like to introduce the Yogena Inversion Sling in a variety of new colors. These would be:

Red fabric + black webbing, Green fabric + black webbing, Orange fabric + yellow webbing, Purple fabric + black webbing



Training Manual


Our Suspension Yoga training manual includes:

Inversions and arm balances
Approach to sequencing
Isolation for alignment in standing poses
Inversions and arm balances
Seated, inverted and standing poses
Safety and modifications
Partner work
Working 1:1
Language and facilitation
Relaxation – forward bends
Installation
Setting up a class room for group classes
Incorporating the sling into existing practice

CLICK HERE TO BUY ON AMAZON

story:
Whether you choose to contribute or not, thank YOU so much for taking the time to browse my campaign. :) 

Pain can be a great teacher, but it also has an insidious side to it, begging one to "settle" and become accustomed to its residency and all the limitations it gladly brings. 

Table of Contents Links:

Intro & Overview
Challenges
Campaign Specific
Sacroiliac Joint Dysfunction (SIJD) Info
What You Get
Other Ways You Can Help

 x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-

Intro & Overview

Hi. My name is Christine.
I'm a pretty interesting person in search of funding for a corrective surgery (Sacroiliac Joint Fixation) to help me alleviate near-constant pain and bodily dysfunction, so that I may reintegrate into a more productive life for both self and others. Though I had some back pain on and off for years, a slip and fall accident (Tom Thumb, Snider Plaza, Dallas!) in 2007 kinda took things to a new level. Quick Info:

I am a:

  • Singer/songwriter
  • Writer (as yet unpublished; this will change)
  • Occasional, small-time, medical advocate for self and others; (I once spurred Parkland Hospital, Dallas, to replace an aging operating table. But please know, this campaign is solely for my own benefit.)
  • Low-income, "disabled," medical patient seeking funding for a corrective surgery.

I have:

  • A history degree
  • A mass Comm degree (recording industry management)
  • A goat who thinks she is my pet (she really belongs to someone else)
  • Lived in London, Los Angeles, NYC, Nashville, Houston, Dallas, and Austin. (There's more, but I'm sparing you.)

I would like to:

  • Alleviate near-constant pain and dysfunction
  • Reintegrate into a more productive life for both self and others 

And by doing so, eventually:

  • Record my second record and tour it *** 
  • Finish the book I've been working on (forever), 
  • Start a non-profit organization (and eventually move forward w/ funding) for all the "Improve/Better Society" ideas I have.
***I was blessed to be able to make a CD a few years back. I was planning on touring it in 09, but I tore the soft tissue in my elbows while ripping up carpet from a small closet, and basically, I couldn't do anything for two years, until after extensive physical therapy. (I'm 1/4 "red-neck" and 3/4 city. I love working on projects; but not so much when I tear myself up like that.) 

-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-

Challenges:

I currently:

  • Live as a "person of disability" (since 1020; Borderline Personality Disorder and chronic pain challenges)
  • Try to participate in life everyday; but I do not work a job.
  • Live under the 2013 Federal Poverty guideline ($11,490 for a family of one).
  • I live in TX and need travel expenses paid because the experts whom I have found (through 6 months of research) are located in Gainesville, GA.

My medical condition:

  • Was previously misdiagnosed (solely as a lumbar spine problem) for quite some time.
  • Is only relieved temporarily by conservative treatments such as 
  • Physical therapy, Chiropractic, Pelvic/SI belt, etc.
  • Medication, both oral and topical
  • Injection therapy (both inter joint (fluoroscopically guided) and trigger point)
  • RF nerve ablation

-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-

Campaign Specific:

While no one can guarantee the outcome of any surgery, I'm confident that with this surgery and after healing time, I will be restored to physical and mental functionality I've not enjoyed for years.

Successful funding of this campaign will allow me to:

  • Travel from Texas to Georgia where I will obtain the "Sacroiliac Joint Fixation" surgery.**
  • Travel back home from Georgia to Texas

Campaign funds will pay for expenses incurred in both the pre- and the post-operative period such as: 

  • Airfare
  • Ground transportation such as car rental and/or taxis
  • "Companion" services as needed. (Medicare does not pay for this, and I will not be allowed to drive for one week.)
  • Lodging during the 4-5 days in Gainesville. (I will also be staying post-op with a friend in Atlanta.)
  • Out of pocket costs associated with the surgical procedure.
  • At home light house-keeping, grocery shopping 
  • The 20% that Medicare does not pay. (Out of state providers routinely do not accept other state-funded QMB Medicaid) 

** There is a chance that I will have to undergo surgery of a more serious nature called Fusion (one of two types). If that happens, my post-operative recovery time will lengthen and I will be far more restricted. As such, I will have to rely on outside assistance for a longer period of time than is necessary for the other, less drastic, fixation surgery. I will likely not know about this decision until the day prior to surgery.

-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-

Sacroiliac Joint Dysfunction (SIJD) Info:

Informative Videos:

  • This excellent video introduces Vicki Sims (Gainesville PT) and tells about SI Joint Dysfunction and malalignment syndrome.
  • Here is a VERY in-depth video by Vicki Sims of Gainesville PT talking about the surgery for a particular, former patient named Kim. Highly recommend watching if you or anyone you know may be suffering from intractable lower back pain.

Interesting SI Facts:

  • The SI joint is in the pelvis; it links the iliac bones to the sacrum (lowest part of spine, above tailbone)
  • The SI joing is the largest axial joint in the body
  • The SI joint transfers weight and forces due to movement from your upper body through the pelvis to your legs and vice versa
  • Disc problems can co-exist with SI joint dysfunction

-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-

What You Get

  • I am setting up a variety of perks/awards which you can see on the right-hand side.
  •  Hopefully, the satisfaction that comes from knowing you truly helped someone.

-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please consider posting this URL to your Facebook, Twitter, or other social media site. 
  • Remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Hi. My name is Christine.I'm a pretty interesting person in search of funding for a corrective surgery (Sacroiliac Joint Fixation) to help me alleviate near-constant pain and bodily dysfunction, so that I may reintegrate into a more productive life for both self and others. Though I had some back pain on and off for years, a slip and fall accident (Tom Thumb, Snider Plaza, Dallas!) in 2007 kinda took things to a new level. 

Quick Info:


I am a:



Singer/songwriter


Writer (as yet unpublished; this will change)


Occasional, small-time, medical advocate for self and others; (I once spurred Parkland Hospital, Dallas, to replace an aging operating table. But please know, this campaign is solely for my own benefit.)


Low-income, "disabled," medical patient seeking funding for a corrective surgery.



I have:



A history degree


A mass Comm degree (recording industry management)


A goat who thinks she is my pet (she really belongs to someone else)


Lived in London, Los Angeles, NYC, Nashville, Houston, Dallas, and Austin. (There's more, but I'm sparing you.)



I would like to:



Alleviate near-constant pain and dysfunction

Reintegrate into a more productive life for both self and others 

And by doing so, eventually:


Record my second record and tour it *** 


Finish the book I've been working on (forever), 


Start a non-profit organization (and eventually move forward w/ funding) for all the "Improve/Better Society" ideas I have.


***I was blessed to be able to make a CD a few years back. I was planning on touring it in 09, but I tore the soft tissue in my elbows while ripping up carpet from a small closet, and basically, I couldn't do anything for two years, until after extensive physical therapy. (I'm 1/4 "red-neck" and 3/4 city. I love working on projects; but not so much when I tear myself up like that.) 


-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-









Challenges:


I currently:



Live as a "person of disability" (since 1020; Borderline Personality Disorder and chronic pain challenges)


Try to participate in life everyday; but I do not work a job.


Live under the 2013 Federal Poverty guideline ($11,490 for a family of one).


I live in TX and need travel expenses paid because the experts whom I have found (through 6 months of research) are located in Gainesville, GA.



My medical condition:



Was previously misdiagnosed (solely as a lumbar spine problem) for quite some time.


Is only relieved temporarily by conservative treatments such as 


Physical therapy, Chiropractic, Pelvic/SI belt, etc.


Medication, both oral and topical


Injection therapy (both inter joint (fluoroscopically guided) and trigger point)

RF nerve ablation


-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-




Campaign Specific:
While no one can guarantee the outcome of any surgery, I'm confident that with this surgery and after healing time, I will be restored to physical and mental functionality I've not enjoyed for years.
Successful funding of this campaign will allow me to:





Travel from Texas to Georgia where I will obtain the "Sacroiliac Joint Fixation" surgery.**


Travel back home from Georgia to Texas




Campaign funds will pay for expenses incurred in both the pre- and the post-operative period such as: 



Airfare


Ground transportation such as car rental and/or taxis


"Companion" services as needed. (Medicare does not pay for this, and I will not be allowed to drive for one week.)


Lodging during the 4-5 days in Gainesville. (I will also be staying post-op with a friend in Atlanta.)


Out of pocket costs associated with the surgical procedure.


At home light house-keeping, grocery shopping 


The 20% that Medicare does not pay. (Out of state providers routinely do not accept other state-funded QMB Medicaid) 



** There is a chance that I will have to undergo surgery of a more serious nature called Fusion (one of two types). If that happens, my post-operative recovery time will lengthen and I will be far more restricted. As such, I will have to rely on outside assistance for a longer period of time than is necessary for the other, less drastic, fixation surgery. I will likely not know about this decision until the day prior to surgery.

-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-

Sacroiliac Joint Dysfunction (SIJD) Info:


Informative Videos:





This excellent video introduces Vicki Sims (Gainesville PT) and tells about SI Joint Dysfunction and malalignment syndrome.


Here is a VERY in-depth video by Vicki Sims of Gainesville PT talking about the surgery for a particular, former patient named Kim. Highly recommend watching if you or anyone you know may be suffering from intractable lower back pain.


Interesting SI Facts:




The SI joint is in the pelvis; it links the iliac bones to the sacrum (lowest part of spine, above tailbone)


The SI joing is the largest axial joint in the body


The SI joint transfers weight and forces due to movement from your upper body through the pelvis to your legs and vice versa

Disc problems can co-exist with SI joint dysfunction





-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-
What You Get


I am setting up a variety of perks/awards which you can see on the right-hand side.

 Hopefully, the satisfaction that comes from knowing you truly helped someone.



-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-
Other Ways You Can Help


Please consider posting this URL to your Facebook, Twitter, or other social media site. 

Remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
ANNA BANANA SOS CAMPAIGN FUND

 

Hello there, I am a real renaissance woman who loves to teach and heal others and serve my community, but due to several setbacks in a row( medically related)  without a safety net all while stuck at a low income,  I have not and am not able to fully share my gifts which would help heal many lives. In other words I want to creatively advocate for others who are struggling to get basic needs and more met.

This campaign is critical to my survival. Your funds will go toward rebuilding my life so that I can make a living once again and share my gifts so that I can help others. 

The funds you generously donate will go specifically toward the following:

lower dental partial(which I have been on waitilist for two years now) and I need this to eat normally again. I lost some big molars due to celiac disease. (3-500.00)

some will go to three months rent (1350.00)

a small amount will go to IRS(200 plus)

massage chair (3-400.00) to start my own business

bankruptcy attorney(1200.00) wipe out my medical/dental debt

teaching permit(45.00) to get more work.

Oral Surgeon(200.00)

Phone(255.00)I wasn't able to keep up after my hours were cut in January.

Affordable Housing waitlist(100.00)

Massage School (5,000.00) to make me more marketable.

With your generous contributions I will be able to get back on my feet and  more!! One of my goals includes starting a theatre troupe to help raise awareness  of the devastating effects of poverty in America on individuals and the consequences for the community as well. I believe this is a great way to humanize the issues and is an important step in realigning our values in this country.

What is in it for you besides becoming known as a Poverty Abolitionist! I think is a great title to have!

Please view Perks and there are plenty!!

story:
What I am doing, who I am, and what I am about:

Greetings! My name is Shelagh Brown and I am an herbalist seeking to reconnect people with nature via plants, yoga, and other ancient healing modalities.

I am ready to continue on my path of healing and self transformation  by completing a Yoga Teacher Certification Training through the only non-profit yoga studio in Seattle, the Samarya Center (http://samaryacenter.org/).

Their visions of community based healing are very in line with my own, and I am incredibly grateful that they have offered me a partial scholarship to compete this training! If you are able to help me achieve my visions, you will have an herbalist and yogi in your corner for lifeand you are contributing to my mission in creating a more harmonious planet for all!

Yoga has completely transformed my life in the last 4 years. It has given me the ability to rise up against an array of trauma, injury and challenge. I want nothing more to be able to offer that same gift to others, while deepening my understanding of myself, humanity and the entire universe.

Yoga is in part responsible for me to taking control of my own health, happiness, and well being, to love the body I have always struggled with and fought against, to be more flexible, patient, loving, and accepting, in mind , body and spirit. I want to help show people from all walks of life, socio-economic backgrounds, ethnicities, shapes and sizes, and limitations that yoga is just as much for them as anyone else!

I am particularly concerned with social justice, and bringing food, health, ecological and medical justice to communities with the least access, particularly communities of color. I am also interested in teaching yoga in prisons and to those living without homes or family.

This is a lifetime journey for me, and I am ready to take the next step. This yoga techer training will so perfectly compliment my studies of Botanical Medicine/Herbal Science which I have been deeply engaged in the last couple years at Bastyr University and will honor my visions of giving others the gift of health through nature and community.

I have been teaching free Herbal Medicine classes to homeless and underserved youth through a local non-profit organization in Seattle and love seeing the excitement in the kids when I share what I know, and they share what they know with me, it is such an incredible exchange of energy and I am so thankful for the opportunity!  I hope that by sharing my healing process with others that I can serve as not only inspiration but provide guidance in whatever ways necessary to aid them on their path.

What I need:

The Samarya Center has blessed me with a partial scholarship but I need help coming up with the rest, so please help out and join me on my journey! I am a full time college student working 4 jobs, supporting and caring for my disabled mother by myself. Any and all help will be recieved with the deepest gratiude, I am grateful for an outlet such as this to tell my story and share my visions with the world, and that so many people so kindly help each other out to fufill our various dreams of making the world a equitable and happy place for all humans.


As an herbalist, I would like to offer my knowledge of plant medicine to those who are able to help me acheive my goal, and will have different donor gift tiers available, all donations will recieve some type of herbal love from me, no matter how small! I am all about connecting and collborating, so if you think we could do some sort of work together, or you have any herbal related questions please do not hesitate to ask, whether you can donate or not!

How you can help, beyond money:

Please help by spreading my story to others via your various social networking accounts, and to friends and family who you think might have an interest in helping me bring yoga to the masses!

story:
Our Story

One day a soldier and a marine were sitting at a Starbucks planning what to do after their tours of service.  Both seemed sad to leave behind a lifestyle of teaching, fitness, and comraderie.  One had since gone into software development, while the other personal training.  Then the light went on!

"We could make an app that contains all the knowledge we have to help people get and STAY fit.  Not one of those 'Get Fit Quick' schemes but something that's real, like how we used to train."

From this conceptual "eureka!" moment came the idea that would become the GTrain project.  Allow me to explain:

Everyone who has ever turned on a TV in the middle of the night has seen the endless barage of info-mercials claiming that in just 10 minutes a day you, too, can look like a fitness model.  Using the miraculous XYZ system used by some professional you may or may not have heard of etc etc etc...

The problem with every last one of these systems is this:  They work just fine for the first couple days, maybe weeks, and just maybe even months.  But in the end, none of them are designed to be sustainable lifestyles.  So the consumer sticks with it, loses the weight, and in 3 months has regained a large portion of the weight they had lost.  They feel like they failed.  Or, worse, the program wasn't right for them and they weren't able to see it through.  It's damaging to self image, confidence, and healthy living.

This is where we come in.  Our system is designed to be an adaptive, intelligent training tool that considers a user's abilities and plans workout routines that are right for each individual person.  Traditional routines are "one size fits most" and rely on the user's enthusiasm to power through.  While this can get people to accomplish great things, that enthusiasm is temporary.  What we need, really need, is something that can fit into and around even the most demanding schedule, adapt to users at various ages and fitness levels, and even compensate for locations like home, gym, track, and so on.  This is what GTrain is designed to do.

As of now we've already completed a prototype, and the app trully does everything it's claiming to.  But this is where we need help:  we don't have the resources to drop everything and go all in with this project (we have day jobs too!).  Luckily the fine folks at Indie Go Go have given us the answer:  you!

 

The GTrain System

The team at Gym Bodies conceived of a system that would intelligently plan workouts for users, adapting to their strengths and schedules, and making the most of their limited time.  This last month, Feb of 2012, we celebrated the completion of a fully functional prototype of the GTrain system.  That's right, we've proven it works.  Currently, however, the system won't be able to handle the user load of a full deployment to the market.

This is where the awesome community at Indie Go Go can help!  With your help we can build out the needed elements and servers to offer this to the public.  We've already created a buzz in Miami, Florida, where competition trainer Kevin Fain has lent his expertise and voice to helping make GTrain a reality!

 

What We Need and What You Get

We need to raise a minumum of $14,000 to make this a reality.  That money will go towards:

- Server setup

- Rebuilding the Database and Portal to handle the user load

- Making it stylish and sleek

- Needed Changes to the core of the app revealed by testing

- Promotional materials to get the word out!

 

If we can raise more, roughly another $6,000, we can do something really cool:

- Build iOS and Droid native versions of GTrain to further enhance usability!

 

In exchange for your support you get exclusive access to the Closed Beta of GTrain, premium membership for a minimum of 1 year from launch, and for coaches exclusive access to the Beta of Coach Connect before it's available to the public.  If you're really nice, we'll throw in all the good schwag you'd normally get for such help!

 

Keep an eye out for us on Facebook and YouTube!

story:
I need your help! As a mom who also happens to be a 3x cancer survivor, LIVESTRONG Leader and supporter of the Lance Armstrong Foundation, I plan on volunteering my time (along with others who have graciously donated their time and talents), to photograph and videotape an amazing week-long camp (Camp Kesem) attended by children who have a parent who has - or has had - cancer. Some of these children have lost their parent(s) to this horrible disease.

On the last day of camp, we will surprise each camper with a beautiful photo book and DVD (free - this is why we need your help). We are seeking funds to help offset the cost of these materials. If there are any remaining funds, they will be donated to Camp Kesem.

Every donation...every single dollar...counts!!!

Details - Camp Kesem and the Lance Armstrong Foundation:

Camp Kesem mission is two-fold:

To provide children affected by a parent’s cancer with a supportive, lifelong camp community that recognizes and understands their unique needs.
To empower college students to make a difference and build invaluable leadership skills by developing and managing every aspect of their Camp Kesem chapter.
Our Purpose

Camp Kesem empowers college student leaders nationwide to create free, life-changing summer camps for children affected by a parent’s cancer.

The Need

There are 1.7 million cancer cases a year in the United States that affect individuals and their families. The support is there for grown-ups; but the special emotional needs of children of adult cancer patients have been overlooked. Simply put: kids are often left to deal with these personal tragedies on their own; and if parents themselves are struggling with illness, their sons and daughters frequently miss the simple joys of childhood.

Lance Armstrong Foundation mission:

We provide support to guide people through the cancer experience, bring them together to fight cancer—and work for a world in which our fight is no longer necessary.

story:
What goes around, comes around - or so we hope! After many years of helping others less fortunate than ourselves, we are hoping it is now our turn for assistance.

For over 10 years my wife, Lorrie, has suffered with debilitating arthritis in her back. She has tried physiotherapy, massage therapy, prolotherapy, chiropractic, and various other natural therapies and medicinal treatments. Nothing has helped enough to give her back her quality of life. Sitting, standing, lying down - no position gives her relief any more.

Recently Lorrie contacted a private spinal clinic in the United States where they perform laser surgery. The doctors indicated that they believe she is a good candidate for their procedure and are sure the surgery would help to alleviate the pain. We have already spent well over $50,000.00 on back treatments in the past. Unfortunately, since this surgery is not done in Canada, the procedure is not covered by Canadian health insurance. 

The cost of the surgery, flights, hotel stay, car rental, food, etc. is beyond our ability to completely afford. We are therefore asking for assistance to pay for the surgery itself which is $20,000 USD. Any amount donated will be greatly appreciated. If we are fortunate enough to exceed our request, any additional amount will be donated to the Arthritis Society to help in their search for a cure for this disease.

If you cannot help financially, that is ok. Please just pass the information along the best way you can! We would appreciate you passing on our plea for help through Facebook, Twitter, or any other avenue available to you.

Once again, we thank you in advance for your help!! THANK YOU for choosing to be a part of this in some way.

story:
A hot-button topic in the military right now, is sexual assault prevention. I was angry, disappointed and disgusted when I heard about the sex scandals at Lackland AFB with trainees. 

It was said, laughably, "Now sergeants are coming forward and talking about sexual assault that they witnessed from their fellow sergeants. This shows how good these men and women are."

No. No it really doesn't. Because if they were truly so good--they would have reported it immediately, rather than waiting until those dirtbags got caught.

 

This unforgivable behavior does not belong in our military. We join the service for various reasons but we're all on the same team. Why should anyone feel like they have to watch out for their supposed 'comrades' over the enemy?

The tech school I am stationed at, DLI in Monterey California, has one of the highest sexual assault rates of any tech school in the military. It is a Joint-Service base--so all military branches attend. Since I arrived here in 2011, almost a dozen of my friends have been sexually assaulted by their fellow service members. And one was assaulted by an instructor. It's ridiculous. 

 

My Chain of Command wants to do the right thing and protect us but I think that it's probably difficult to get real stories from real people. The survivors tend not to trust the Commands because the victims are accused of lying, of exaggerating, that they should expect to be assaulted in the military--especially if they are female, or simply nothing is done with their case. It's sickening to me, the females I've met who were told that nothing would be done about the assault they suffered and they just need to let it go.

 

Let me tell you--I was abused for four years--you can't just 'let it go'. It's impossible. The effect it has on the psyche is catastrophic. It obliterates trust, makes you feel unsafe, makes you hate the very people you are SUPPOSED to be able to look up to for guidance and support. It ruins any sort of pride one has in the armed services of this nation. Comitting sexual assault and abuse is the most underhanded, cruel torture that someone can do to another person. Our laws are so ridiculously weak when it comes to dealing with rapists. Five to seven years in prison? Don't make me laugh; it's insulting.

 

So I want to do this project and try to find out why this problem is so prominent at DLI. I have a degree in History and research; so I have the academic tools but I need some additional equipment. I want to get a digital handheld recorder and I want to be able to conduct proper interviews and to compensate the victims for their time. I would also like to acquire the proper recording software for my computer.

If this project is successful, I am hoping to present it to the Commander of my unit. I want to help those who have been hurt and I think maybe if I could find some common factors and back it up, than they would have a better idea of what direction to go to help the survivors. I want to bring some transperency to the Commands as well. Call them out on their hypocrisy and disgusting tolerance of rape.

 

So, that's what I want to do. Thank you so much for your time. Please spread this around if you can. 

 

Thank you

Katie Ridenour
story_txt:
A hot-button topic in the military right now, is sexual assault prevention. I was angry, disappointed and disgusted when I heard about the sex scandals at Lackland AFB with trainees. 
It was said, laughably, "Now sergeants are coming forward and talking about sexual assault that they witnessed from their fellow sergeants. This shows how good these men and women are."
No. No it really doesn't. Because if they were truly so good--they would have reported it immediately, rather than waiting until those dirtbags got caught.
 
This unforgivable behavior does not belong in our military. We join the service for various reasons but we're all on the same team. Why should anyone feel like they have to watch out for their supposed 'comrades' over the enemy?
The tech school I am stationed at, DLI in Monterey California, has one of the highest sexual assault rates of any tech school in the military. It is a Joint-Service base--so all military branches attend. Since I arrived here in 2011, almost a dozen of my friends have been sexually assaulted by their fellow service members. And one was assaulted by an instructor. It's ridiculous. 
 
My Chain of Command wants to do the right thing and protect us but I think that it's probably difficult to get real stories from real people. The survivors tend not to trust the Commands because the victims are accused of lying, of exaggerating, that they should expect to be assaulted in the military--especially if they are female, or simply nothing is done with their case. It's sickening to me, the females I've met who were told that nothing would be done about the assault they suffered and they just need to let it go.
 
Let me tell you--I was abused for four years--you can't just 'let it go'. It's impossible. The effect it has on the psyche is catastrophic. It obliterates trust, makes you feel unsafe, makes you hate the very people you are SUPPOSED to be able to look up to for guidance and support. It ruins any sort of pride one has in the armed services of this nation. Comitting sexual assault and abuse is the most underhanded, cruel torture that someone can do to another person. Our laws are so ridiculously weak when it comes to dealing with rapists. Five to seven years in prison? Don't make me laugh; it's insulting.
 
So I want to do this project and try to find out why this problem is so prominent at DLI. I have a degree in History and research; so I have the academic tools but I need some additional equipment. I want to get a digital handheld recorder and I want to be able to conduct proper interviews and to compensate the victims for their time. I would also like to acquire the proper recording software for my computer.
If this project is successful, I am hoping to present it to the Commander of my unit. I want to help those who have been hurt and I think maybe if I could find some common factors and back it up, than they would have a better idea of what direction to go to help the survivors. I want to bring some transperency to the Commands as well. Call them out on their hypocrisy and disgusting tolerance of rape.
 
So, that's what I want to do. Thank you so much for your time. Please spread this around if you can. 
 
Thank you
Katie Ridenour

story:
On September 5, 2012, David McCann was shot severely injuring him and changing his life forever.

David McCann, a Plum Borough resident, found himself in a bad situation and another young man tried to take his life in a horrible act of violence. We are asking for your love, support and help for David and his family at this time. Dave has always been a very caring and loving person to his family and friends. He did not deserve to be shot and possibly the ability to walk again taken away from him. He is the loving father of three young sons, an uncle, a brother, a caring son and many other roles to people in his life. This incident happened days before his 30th birthday.

Now David needs your friendship and support so he can get through this difficult time and be there for everyone that needs him, especially his 3 young sons. His family needs our help too, so they can afford to make their home handicap accessible in order for Dave to come home. He still has hope, but his life may be changed forever.  If Dave remains paralyzed then he will need new transportation and other physical rehabilitation. 

What We Need & What You Get

ANYTHING you can donate WILL help! David is still in the hospital and his condition is still being determined. As of today, his diagnosis is paralysis from the waist down with a 10% chance of walking again. If you have spoken to him since the accident, you know that he is staying positive and is thankful to be alive. In order for David to come home, the McCann family needs to remodel a portion of their house with handicap access. He would be more comfortable being able to recover at home with his family and friends around. We hope to at least help them fund this effort. Before this happened, David could not afford health insurance with his job as a landscaper.  His medical costs are undetermined right now, but he already has several costly bills and many future expenses. No matter what amount you can donate it will greatly help him and his family with the related costs from this tragedy.

If we do not reach the goal, the funds will still go to the same place and help his family with medical bills and handicap remodeling and associated costs.

The Impact

Your donation will not only help Dave and his family with the costs they are incurring from this horrible situation, but it will ultimately show your love and support for his recovery.  He needs this positive impact right now. Becoming paralyzed at age 30 with three kids is a lot to swallow, but not the end! You can also help Dave turn his life into something positive for other young people facing similar issues.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot give a monetary donation, there are many ways you can help and show support. 
 
You can visit Dave or send him a card or something to brighten his spirits.
 
If you or someone you know have any remodeling or related experience, you could offer your services to his family.
 
If you or someone you know is paralyzed, they could offer advice or friendship for Dave.
 

Thank you for visiting this page!  Please help Dave and his family in this very serious time of need.

story:
Campaign Introduction

My name is Adam Greene and I am a part time photojournalist. In March of this year I went to Israel and the Palestinian Territories to photograph and interview Israelis and Palestinians for a project I am working on a project Voices For Peace www.ipvfp.wordpress.com. During this trip I made contact with a Palestinian family I met 30 years ago. Upon meeting the family I learnt about the situation 21 year old Nidawr is facing. As a child she seriously injured her left eye which is now causing her a good deal of pain and has now lost her sight. Since taking taking the above photograph of her there is considerable inflamation around the eye and she has to wear an eye patch. She has become quite depressed about her appearance. The sum of money needed for the operations is not huge ($2000) but will dramatically change Nidawrs appearnce and alleviate the daily pain she currently experiences.

What Nidawr Needs

I am out to raise $2000 which will cover the cost of the 2 operations needed. The cost of surgery is approximately $1700 and the remainder is for the cost of transport and permits. The first operation is scheduled for september 10th 2015 at the St John Eye Hospital in East Jerusalem with the following operation to be undertaken 2 weeks later. Nidawr's father Adnan is unemployed and has an approximate income of $400 a month. Nidawrs current medication costs are about $200 a month so there has been a huge finacial strain for the family. I will be raising funds from other sources so I am confident about raising the total amount needed. Any extra funds raised will be used to pay back money that has been loaned to the family


Why this is Important

Primarily this is an appeal on a straightforward humanitarian level. But this does go deeper. This is about breaking through the barriers that exist between Jews and Muslims (as I myself am of Jewish heritage) and as part of my project between Israelis and Palestinians who are opposing violence and extremism and looking for ways forward of living and relating to eachother where politicians are failing.
Find me on Facebook. Adam Greene on Facebook

story:
Here's a Short Summary

A beautiful bunch of friends, family, musicians, artists and basically the good people in Comets life have got together and decided to help her get the operation she so desperately needs. 
Here's a few things about Comet you might not know:

  • Comet tirelessly works behind the background, forever promoting deserving artists who just need that leg-up, that start, that connection to get them on their way.
  • If someone is in trouble, needs a bit of a hand getting back on their feet or just a little something to make them know they count in this life, Comet will be there fundraising, asking other friends to help or just sending little surprises in the mail to people who need to know they are loved.
  • Comet and her fiance' Matty will be spending their honeymoon in a hospital as Comet gets the surgery she needs.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $12,000 for Comet because:

  • Comet needs an operation that can't wait.
  • She has not been able to work since June and Herself and her fiance'Matthew are trying to cover costs of the medical bills along with paying their weekly bills.
  • With your help she'll not only be able to conquer this setback but beat this challenge head on.
  • The entire funds are going to the medical costs involved with Comets surgery, recovery and medical specialist visits.

The Impact

Woman don't talk about their health problems and most keep issues to themselves until sometimes it can be too late:

  • Raising awareness regarding womens health is something Comet feels she will get out of this and hope to pass this message onto other woman.
  • If you've got an issue with your body, only you know your body the best.
    Speak up, see your Doctor and don't settle for an answer you don't believe is correct.
  • When was your last pap smear ladies? Comet thought hers was only a few years ago, turns out it was almost 8 years ago. Things could have been so different.
  • We get too wrapped up in our lives to stop and take note of what our bodies are saying to us, we need to change this so more people can live longer, fulfilling lives.

Risks & Challenges

The risk of Comet not achieving her goal is something she isn't going to settle for.

  • As most of you know, she is a determined lady with a BIG heart and is seen most of the time helping others in need.
  • If there is a will, there's a way.
  • With your help of donating or grabbing a perk or 2, you'll not only get to set Comet back on her journey of helping others but you'll also be helping save her health and possibly her life.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Offer your support, your love, that is something BIGGER  than money can buy.
  • Have you got a perk you want to donate? We all love a good perk, the more perks, the more chance we have of Comet achieving her goal.
