story:
Toronto Elites Ultimate fosters the sport of Ultimate Frisbee by providing opportunities to learn, play, and teach spirited Ultimate in the Greater Toronto Area.

  • We are extremely passionate about the sport of Ultimate and are driven to make Toronto Juniors Ultimate the best in Canada. We need help from the community to create a sustainable program.
  • We want to give junior aged athletes an exceptional experience that includes high level coaching (see below), experience at multiple tournaments, and much more!
  • We want to change the culture and quality of Juniors Ultimate in Toronto so that our great city is properly represented in the Ultimate community. 
  • High level coaching - Combined our coaches have played at the highest level of the sport, have coached Canada's U23 + U19 National team and professional teams (RUSH), various high school teams (including National champions) and have the highest NCCP qualifications. We also follow Ultimate Canada's Long Term Athlete Development program. We want to give Toronto's youth the best coaching and playing experience!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $10,000 to create a bursary program, provide athletes with transportation to tournaments, and create a stable financial structure for years to come.
  • What you can get - TORO Discs, TORO Jerseys and TORO Swag!
  • If we reach our goal. 50% will go to player bursaries, 25% will go to buses, 25% will go to the operating cost for 2015 season.

The Impact

Your contribution WILL make a difference to young athletes interested in playing ultimate in Toronto!

  • We receive many emails from teachers and players about athletes who want to play but do not have the money available to cover the basic fees to play a sport. We want to build a base for a bursary fund to help these athletes.
  • Ultimate tournaments are very far away. In order to be the best we must play against the best. Your donation will also help us transport athletes to tournaments in Ontario (Montreal, Ottawa). 
  • We have finished in the top three at Nationals for the past 4 years. We are a quality program and we want to offer it to as many young players as possible.


Risks & Challenges

We have many obstacles in our way. We need people (especially teachers) to promote ultimate in their communities and local schools. We need to be able to offer those who need it some availability to donated money. 

  • We are passionate, dedicated and experienced coaches who will provide a challenging and positive learning and playing experience. 
  • We give a great deal of time because we love ultimate and we have witnessed first hand the positive experiences it provides to youth in the city of Toronto. Help us offer this experience to so many more athletes! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Thanks for taking the time to read this page!
Sincerely,
Elites Ultimate Coaches - Carla DiFilippo, Evan Phillips, Todd Melville, Erica Tucker, Jane Lee, Shawn Chua, Gabe Isaac, Emma Seaborn, Rob Grundy, Andrea Kurahashi, Erin Bussin

story:
Charlie, Helena and their 2 children Alex and Poppy had their home and all of their belonging taken by a recent fire. Let's show them the community is supporting them and thinking of them.
Fortunately they will be moving into a new home shortly but they have nothing for it.
Please give what you can , all contributions will be happily accepted and put to use.

OTHER THINGS THEY NEED:
Once they have had a chance to know what (if anything) they can recover we will be accepting household and furniture donations.

For any gift card donations please contact Chaya Jorgensen 604-892-4518 to arrange a delivery.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Please share this site and help spread the word far and wide. Share across your personal and business facebook pages.

XOXOXO
We love you Helena, Charlie, Alex and Poppy!!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Hello. We are requesting financial assistance for my husband and myself,  as he recovers from his third bone marrow transplant.

Phillip is 64 years old and was diagnosed with Multiple Myeloma in the spring of 2010.  He began chemotherapy immediately, in order to prepare for a transplant in the fall. After a leg break in July, 2010 a week before his first scheduled transplant, the transplant was postponed until September 2010. At his 100 day checkup, we were told it was not as successful as they would like and preparations began for a tandem transplant for February 2011. After developing H1N1 and then shingles, he was finally able to receive a second transplant on May 22, 2011. He was only able to reach partial remission at 96%.  Phillip was able to donate his own cells for both of these transplants, as well as some for a future autologous stem cell transplant, if needed.

After receiving three and one-half years of maintenance chemotherapy, twice a week, his panels indicated that the current chemotherapy was no longer working and that he would need a third transplant, much earlier than the anticipated 7 to 10 year window first predicted.  After switching to two different forms of chemotherapy, he was prepped for his third transplant this past summer. He donated his cells again for this transplant and Day Zero, our his Rebirthday as many call this, was October 20, 2014.

On October 24th, he began to have complications from the transplant and has been in the hospital fighting an unexplained high fever and blood pressure issues. After a scary day of possibly being admitted to the ICU, he was stabilized and is doing better overall. We anticipate being able to return home on Monday or Tuesday of this week, after he is fever free and provided no other infections set in.

We are requesting financial assistance to support us while I am off work for 4 to 6 weeks, as a teacher's assistant in our local school district for a preschool/Head Start program. Phillip is medically retired from the Navy and receives pay from the US Navy and from Social Security.  As of this point, we no longer have any savings and know what our immediate expenses will be for each month.  The only variables will be medications that change, sometimes daily, transportation costs of a 50 mile roundtrip visit daily from our home for at least 4 weeks, and any further hospital stays and costs associated with personal expenses while hospitalized. Due to my extended leave time, I will not be receiving any income in December and possibly January, if I am not cleared to go back to work. He needs 24/7 care during the recovery time, as well as follow up visits in December, January, and February. Our personal finances include rent, car payment, car insurance, utilities, cable, cellular service, college student loans, and one credit card. Without assistance, we will lose our ability to travel to the hospital, maintain telephone contact with the hospital and with family and friends, both of which are very important in the recovery process. We live within our means under normal circumstances and at this transplant only adds to the financial stress on our paycheck-to paycheck budget.  Not to mention, we will not be making any purchases for Christmas presents for our six children or our four grand children, nor ourselves, without a little breathing room.

We would greatly appreciate any help and thank you in advance for your consideration and donation.
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello. We are requesting financial assistance for my husband and myself,  as he recovers from his third bone marrow transplant.
Phillip is 64 years old and was diagnosed with Multiple Myeloma in the spring of 2010.  He began chemotherapy immediately, in order to prepare for a transplant in the fall. After a leg break in July, 2010 a week before his first scheduled transplant, the transplant was postponed until September 2010. At his 100 day checkup, we were told it was not as successful as they would like and preparations began for a tandem transplant for February 2011. After developing H1N1 and then shingles, he was finally able to receive a second transplant on May 22, 2011. He was only able to reach partial remission at 96%.  Phillip was able to donate his own cells for both of these transplants, as well as some for a future autologous stem cell transplant, if needed.
After receiving three and one-half years of maintenance chemotherapy, twice a week, his panels indicated that the current chemotherapy was no longer working and that he would need a third transplant, much earlier than the anticipated 7 to 10 year window first predicted.  After switching to two different forms of chemotherapy, he was prepped for his third transplant this past summer. He donated his cells again for this transplant and Day Zero, our his Rebirthday as many call this, was October 20, 2014. 
On October 24th, he began to have complications from the transplant and has been in the hospital fighting an unexplained high fever and blood pressure issues. After a scary day of possibly being admitted to the ICU, he was stabilized and is doing better overall. We anticipate being able to return home on Monday or Tuesday of this week, after he is fever free and provided no other infections set in.
We are requesting financial assistance to support us while I am off work for 4 to 6 weeks, as a teacher's assistant in our local school district for a preschool/Head Start program. Phillip is medically retired from the Navy and receives pay from the US Navy and from Social Security.  As of this point, we no longer have any savings and know what our immediate expenses will be for each month.  The only variables will be medications that change, sometimes daily, transportation costs of a 50 mile roundtrip visit daily from our home for at least 4 weeks, and any further hospital stays and costs associated with personal expenses while hospitalized. Due to my extended leave time, I will not be receiving any income in December and possibly January, if I am not cleared to go back to work. He needs 24/7 care during the recovery time, as well as follow up visits in December, January, and February. Our personal finances include rent, car payment, car insurance, utilities, cable, cellular service, college student loans, and one credit card. Without assistance, we will lose our ability to travel to the hospital, maintain telephone contact with the hospital and with family and friends, both of which are very important in the recovery process. We live within our means under normal circumstances and at this transplant only adds to the financial stress on our paycheck-to paycheck budget.  Not to mention, we will not be making any purchases for Christmas presents for our six children or our four grand children, nor ourselves, without a little breathing room.
We would greatly appreciate any help and thank you in advance for your consideration and donation.

story:
Like most 26 year-olds with brand new masters degrees, I am uninsured and working retail. However, unlike most 26 year-olds, I suffer from PMDD, a disorder which basically takes normal pms and turns it into full-blown anxiety and near-suicidal depression that leaves me largely unable to function for two weeks out of every month.

I've discovered that Lexapro helps immensely, but at $117/month, I'm having trouble continuing to afford this treatment. I did my best to sign up for our new cheap government health insurance (thanks, Obama!), but the Health Insurance Marketplace made several unreconcilable mistakes which now mean that I may not be insured until January, and even after this, my $400 deductible means I will still be paying out of pocket well into the next year (#thanksobama).

So I've come to you and Indiegogo to help mitigate these costs while I'm still attempting to find a Real Person Job, pay off student loans, and pay all the other various bills that are involved in being a human in 2014.

Any amount of help would be enormously appreciated - thank you from the bottom of my heart.

story:
3 Minute Yoga: A Revolution in Health & Vitality

I believe everyone can benefit from safe and simple yoga practices. Some people do not feel comfortable being in a yoga class or have time to visit a studio. That's why my video production team and I are creating high quality videos to bring yoga directly to you. My videos will encourage you to incorporate yoga into your daily life.

  • These poses can be done anywhere. Yoga videos will run on your smart phone, laptop, or electronic device - so that you can do yoga at work, or for a few minutes in between meetings, at home, or even at the airport. These simple yoga videos will help you improve posture, mood, flexibility, and self-confidence without having to travel to an actual studio.
  • With your help, my team and I will create videos and web presence, offering you greater health and vitality. Your commitment is just a few minutes each day. 

I am Molly Lesmeister. I own a yoga studio in Decorah, Iowa, where I teach from the Iyengar school of yoga. Iyengar Yoga, named after B.K.S Iyengar, is a form of Hatha Yoga that has an emphasis on detail, precision, and alignment in the performance of posture (asana) and breath control (pranayama).

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $12,500 to produce high quality videos and develop our website and outreach.  The funds will be used to pay for video production and website development.  If we exceed our goal, we will develop additional videos and expand our website.  
  • When we meet our goal, we will create a series of 3- minute yoga poses designed for moments throughout your work day.  We will create a 20-minute yoga practice targeted for an energizing mid-afternoon work break. 
  • Everyone who contributes will receive material to enhance your yoga practice.  See our Perks section on the right side of the screen. 
  • Stay tuned during our campaign to follow our progress and hear about bonus perks, including an upcoming yoga celebration event.
  • You can help us by sharing this video with your friends and family who are interested in improving their health and vitality.

The Impact

The new yoga revolution begins here, in Decorah, Iowa. By creating short yoga breaks throughout the day, you will get a daily practice to revolutionize your health and your life. 

  • In short, everyone from any economic background, geographic location, or family situation, deserves the health benefits of yoga.  With your help, we can bring yoga to everyone: for those who are always on the go, for those who are behind a desk, or for those who live in areas where a yoga studio isn't available, or is cost prohibitive. 
  • Our amazing video and technical support team, Corbin Group, has the expertise to make this a reality. See more about this sustainability-focused firm at www.corbingroup.biz

Join us! People who do yoga will testify to their improved sense of well-being, lower stress, and greater happiness.  

“I take yoga from Molly.  You don’t have to sell the health benefits of yoga to me now.”  Linda Watson-Decorah, Iowa.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if a financial contribution is not something you can do right now, help us spread the word and share this video with your friends! Click on the share tools from Indiegogo website to share.

Namaste.

story:
Hi there,

My name is Shelley I am 30 years old and have Bipolar Disorder. In May this year I found myself unemployed due to having long term absences and since then I have struggled with both emotions and finances. I have contacted my local government about the options and hopefully I will find alternative accommodation, but that will mean giving up the home I love and the cats I adore. I am looking for donations, as little or as much as possible, please share this with friends, family and organisations that you think may be in a position to help me.


Thank you :)

story:
Yes, this is "25 and Inspired: What can Dharma Yoga do for you?" 

   a fun-draising campaign by Michael Sean "Shen" Jones. 


Do you want to see more embodied young men 

taking action in this world, 

creating careers that are in integrity,

 that heal and empower and inspire? 

 Hopefully your answer is" well, of course." 

I am facing the collective shadows of financial abundance and "a job" by stepping up to serve others in a way that I feel truly benefits them.  I want my cake and Im going to eat it too.

The goal of this project is to Give and get Inspired doing it.  Simple.  

I want to get certified in a top-notch yoga teacher training program at the Dharma Yoga Center in NYC.  

I want to share this Amazing yoga science with my community, friends and family.

 I want to create a career that empowers me to live healthy and happy by supporting others in doing the same. 

 YOU can make this happen. 

Check out the Fantastic Perks I am offering. See what inspires you and know that you have inspired me just by reading this post and visiting my campaign. 


 Thank you, thank you, thank you, for taking your time to participate.  

 In JOY,

 Shen 


  the story ~A bit on how I got here.


 I have enjoyed the benefits of a consistent study and practice of Yoga by many teachers, many styles.  The philosophy and the effects of a dedicated practice have transformed my life. I nearly committed suicide right before I turned 21,(the irony is not lost on me here)...I spent years of late night drinking, drugging, unhealthy relationships, poor choices, poor diet, etc. Really did not have a compass to navigate the dangers of being young in the culture on the East End of Long Island.  Mid March of 2010 I went way too far, drank way too much, vengefully, challenging death...I woke up having little recollection of the event.  But I was extremely sick and had a feeling that something had shifted. I don't know whether it was grace or God or luck or a high tolerance...but I survived and that day forward I sought to create a positive life that would benefit others. 

I went on a healing journey of epic proportions: backpacking through Europe, crossing the continent in a Greyhound to work on farms in Santa Barbara and Oregon, music festivals, fairs, new people, new places, new culture, a new life.

  I came to see the consumption commerical charade that plagues my hometown and much of urbanized technocratic societies was not the only way to live. I saw how these choices we make continue to exacerbate the craving and aversion duality that destroys our bodymindspirits...

Yoga came naturally, as a way to deepen the inner peace I had found with a new chapter to my life.  I found the benefits were amazing.  Increased focus, greater comfort in my body, vitality/strength, better decision making, less struggle and more flow...more living, less fighting.

 In 2012 I read Autobiography of a Yogi, and soon was inspired to study and learn in depth. 

 Here's an article by a Hatha Yoga master, Joel Kramer. He speaks of the process of transformation that occurs, which accurately reflects my own experience for sure.  

http://www.joeldiana.com/downloads/writings/YogaAsSelfTransformation.pdf



 


Commonly Asked Questions

(READ THIS ONE) How can I get my Rewards,( yoga, energy healing, etc.,) if we are not in the same place?

Due to the awesome power of collective action through micro-finance, many people can donate from exotic destinations. Thus internet, cellphone means of connecting to me is required for you to receive your reward.  It is not uncommon to do long distance healings, nutritional guidance, and yes! Even yoga asana.

 Check the answer to the “What is Edutainment…” to read more about where I plan on visiting geographically this year.

What is Dharma Yoga?

Dharma Yoga refers to the yogic science as taught by Dharma Mittra. Dharma has created multiple series of postures (asanas) specific to his own perspective and style. This yoga teacher training course is under his supervision, at his school in New York City.


Wait, who is Dharma Mittra?

Dharma Mittra is a 75-years-young Brazilian yogi master, who in his early twenties began learning and teaching various forms of yoga in NYC.  He continues to do so to this day.  He's a gem of a human being as well :-) 


 Why are you asking for six thousand dollars? 

  The pricing goes as follows: 

    3,995.00 for the full tuition 

 500.00 for the 14 days prior to the start date of the training

 220.00 books, materials and app fee

 1000.00+  transportation, food, rent for two weeks in Manhattan (welcome to New York City) 



What is energy healing and Light of the Eternal One?

 Ever heard the adage, “Energy flows where attention goes?” Well this is a basic starting point to getting energy healing, and well, creating anything. It all begins with a thought.  Energy healing is, for me, an attraction of certain frequencies of energy that vibrate at very high, harmonic levels. Take Dr. Emoto’s water experiments, as an excellent example of how thought can affect matter.  Light of the Eternal One is a specific energy of tremendous joy and harmony; it brings elements of life into wholeness and love. When I do sessions on myself (which I do daily), I soon feel a blissful state melt away any crap that I was carrying.  In a longer session, I get the benefits of an outstanding meditation, which transforms my whole being. I am patient and at peace, happy and strong within my mind and that’s worth a lot to me. That’s one of the reasons why I am excited to offer the chance to experience the energy to others.

Here is the website for Brett, who teaches this wonderful energy healing modality: 

http://brettbevell.com/wordpress/books-2/energy-healing-for-everyone/


What is “Edu-tainment” and why would I want to participate? Is it really worth it?

Edu-tainment is a way to label workshop, with an obvious emphasis on play, or entertainment. If you are familiar with the Waldorf school and their philosophy around learning, it’s a similar basic idea: we learn better by doing what interests us, by playing. By following our passion, our curiosity.

Edu-tainment “workshops” will be a never-before-seen fusion of dance, yoga, meditation, raw foods and superfoods, energy healing, improv acting, singing, talks and discussions with stellar teachers of the vibrant living/edu-tainment paradigm (myself included)…How much fun can we have doing what truly nourishes us and inspires us on a deep level? How much potent knowledge can we share, information that empowers us to take greater joy in taking responsibility for our health, our passions, our shadows and our destiny? 

So far, these locations are tentative destinations for the Edu-tainment offering:

East End of Long Island, NY

NYC

Asheville, NC

Sedona, AZ

Bay Area, CA

Beloved Sacred Art and Music Festival (Tidewater Falls, OR)

What is Holistic Health Mastery and “an assessment”?

Holistic Health Mastery is a brand-spankin’ new integrated nutrition program, primarily created by Ronnie Landis.  The program introduction reads : “…the goal of this course is to empower you to be the best version of yourself ever!” I HIGHLY recommend giving the website a look. He’s posted an outline of the curriculum and it is EXTENSIVE, from superfoods to detox to hormonal health to sungazing, Ronnie’s complied over a dedicated athletic career and successful health coaching business, a powerful knowledge base. 

The assessment is my way of building a greater understanding with you of your body, mind, and spirit. It creates a baseline so we can see Where you are at.

 As Lao-Tzu supposedly said, “If you do not change your direction, you may end up where you are heading.”

That’s why the assessment is crucial. AND you do it with me, so I include various techniques I’ve learned throughout my journey with Traditional Chinese Medicine, intuitive energy work and cutting edge science.




 What's the deal with the Music and Poetry lesson? 

 Music and poetry have, since I can remember at like 5 years of age, passions.  Now I have dedicated an immense amount of focus to cultivating these arts into real skills.  It is a Journey every day, just to sing and play my own music.  

 the Music and Poetry lesson will empower you to explore your voice, your body, your writing, your story, and most importantly, it will be fun.  Vocal exercises, playing with questions like where does music come from, what is poetry, how can you really express what you feel, what you want to communicate, etc.  I have been told by more than a few friends that I hold safe, effective space for this type of learning.  It gives me tremendous satisfaction to warm up the pen and the vocal chords and be witness (and conductor) to someone else's songs.  We have a Bard in all of us! Let's entice it out to share it's magic.

story:
Our Mission

  • Change Medicine making it a global network.
  • Save lives by providing a faster response time.
  • Stop narcotics from hitting the streets and affecting the youth.
  • Save trees by eliminating unnecessary use of paper.
  • Save kids and adults lives involved in accidents or who have preexisting conditions.

How are we going to do it?

  1. Build a system that enables a global network for hospitals.
  2. Build a card reading system that allows for concise information of victims/patients.
  3. Get this system inside of every first responders hand and every hospitals.
  4. We're going to manufacture the tablets that use the scanning software right here in the US bringing jobs directly to the US.
  5. We're going to save money for hospitals enabling them to stop cutting jobs.

Why us?

We are passionate about saving lives and we'll keep fighting until every hospital is equipped with a system that might save your life some day.

Why donate?

When you donate you're enabling us to get this to market at a faster rate then we previously thought possible while right now it's a small team we plan to grow to bring this to market and offer the much needed support for it. Whether you donate or not please share and bring your friends and change the world with us.

How can i help?

Spread the word without you the people we're nothing lets make a safer world and save some lives while doing it. Remember to share this on twitter and facebook!

What will the funds be used for?

The funds donated will be used towards getting this technology into the market eventually leading to hopefully every hospital in the united states using Medi Pronto and saving millions of lives.

What's this conference you speak of?

The conference will be in Illinois (The location hasn't been decided) It will be invite only inviting some of the highest execs in the medical industry and hopefully you!

These perks aren't that cool! I want cool perks!

Our product really doesn't allow us to offer cool perks one thing that we can say though is if you contribute to Medi Pronto you'll be both protecting the youth of tomorrow and very possibly your own life.

Who are we?


MediPronto is a medical company founded in 2014 by Corey J. Seaman. MediPronto is a patented system that works for all medical facilities. The function, allows for doctor’s offices, EMS staff, and hospitals to access patient information instantly. The system works by having the staff member simply scan the patient’s I.D. The system is based around the thought of one of your loved ones being in a car accident, the EMS staff has little information about your loved one, no known information about medications they are on, recent surgeries, and any known other known medical issues being readily on hand to assist them. With this information handy at the scene this will help the responder instantly know all the information possible to help your loved one during the unfortunate and unthinkable, saving precious minutes and seconds that will prove to be valuable.

 The system goes further. Imagine, going to the doctors office and only having to check-in by scanning your I.D. and then your file is immediately pulled up on the doctors tablet. This not only eliminates time but also cost of paper as well as the we evolve into a paperless world.This will help doctors and medical staff not only know longer lose files, have a hard time finding files but have them there immediately by simply scanning the patients I.D. 

 At MediPronto we believe that better organization leads to fewer mistakes, fewer mistakes leads to less misdiagnosis’ wether it’s at the doctors office or that the scene of an unthinkable car accident. We believe in innovating the medical world today for a better tomorrow.

Contact Us

Have any questions about us feel free to contact us for interviews etc.

Email: cjseaman@avurex.com

Telephone: +1(309)-264-2981


Notice: Our new website is under construction and will be up soon during this campaign!

Thank you for your time,

Much love from the MediPronto Team.
story_txt:
Our Mission
Change Medicine making it a global network.
Save lives by providing a faster response time.
Stop narcotics from hitting the streets and affecting the youth.
Save trees by eliminating unnecessary use of paper.
Save kids and adults lives involved in accidents or who have preexisting conditions.
How are we going to do it?
Build a system that enables a global network for hospitals.
Build a card reading system that allows for concise information of victims/patients.
Get this system inside of every first responders hand and every hospitals.
We're going to manufacture the tablets that use the scanning software right here in the US bringing jobs directly to the US.
We're going to save money for hospitals enabling them to stop cutting jobs.
Why us?We are passionate about saving lives and we'll keep fighting until every hospital is equipped with a system that might save your life some day.Why donate?When you donate you're enabling us to get this to market at a faster rate then we previously thought possible while right now it's a small team we plan to grow to bring this to market and offer the much needed support for it. Whether you donate or not please share and bring your friends and change the world with us.How can i help?Spread the word without you the people we're nothing lets make a safer world and save some lives while doing it. story:
One Year Ago

On September 21, 2013, I lost one of the most important people in my life to a fight with colon cancer. Exactly one year later, I will be competing in the Rock and Roll Half-Marathon. 

It will be my very first Half Marathon and I would love to run it in memory of the woman who helped me become the person I am today. Donations will be given to the American Cancer Society to aid in the research, treatment, and eradication of cancer.

    The Impact

    Colorectal cancer is cancer that starts in either the colon or the rectum. Colon cancer and rectal cancer have many features in common. They are discussed together here except for the section about treatment, where they are discussed separately.
    Thanks to improvements in prevention, early detection, and treatment, more than a million people in the US count themselves as survivors of colon or rectum cancer (also called colorectal cancer).

    With your help, the American Cancer Society is saving the birthdays that might otherwise be lost to cancer. We are extremely committed to our obligation to spend donor dollars wisely. Here’s a year-end glimpse at how your donations helped save lives every day. Data is from 2012.

    This year, we celebrate a 20 percent decline in cancer death rates since 1991.

    Overall, 72% of the American Cancer Society resources go to cancer research, patient support, prevention information and education, and detection and treatment. The remaining 28% of resources are spent on management compensation and general infrastructure, and fundraising expenses.

    Resources allocated to Program Services include:
    • $160 million spent on Cancer Research
    • $304 million spent on Patient Support
    • $153 million spent on Prevention Information/Education
    • $97 million spent on Detection and Treatment


      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't donate at this time, don't worry!

      • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
      • There's also lots of way to give to the American Cancer Society. Here are some ways: http://www.cancer.org/involved/morewaystogive/index
      • Come out to support the Rock and Roll Runners on September 21, 2014! http://runrocknroll.competitor.com/philadelphia

story:
Marketplace for small organic Farmers

My name is Christopher Emille Jayanata, I started to getting close with agriculture since my childhood, as my parents are coming from agronomy educational background.

And I went into this kind of business myself by 2001. I introduced the use of probiotic to farmers in Java Island, Indonesia, to substitute their usage of chemical fertilizer and pesticide.

Chemical Over-usage in Indonesian Agriculture

Yet I was surprised with the over-usage of toxic ingredients in their crop process. Not only they will harm the environments with this overdose chemical usage, but also poisoning the consumers of those products.

In 2008 I found that organic farmers are growing, as the result of crop failure and other effect caused by pesticide and chemical fertilizers overuse. The farmers are strive to get a better crop with more traditional ways, and practicing organic farming methods.

More Organic and More Natural Products Start to Grow

In the same time, my friends and I also found that there were several enterprises whose products are in organic, green and healthy procedure. Most of the producers are micro in size and experiences. Their condition of chemical substance sensitivity trigger their deeds. They become the producers of many Organic, Green and Healthy products first for themselves, for their family, and then for their society as well.

Now they are growing, as the effects of the chemical misuse over range of products, food and non-food are also accelerating. But yet, they have difficulties to sell those products, as the lack of communication to market. These farmers and enterprises usually can only produce a little

So Many People Need, So Little The Information

On the other hand, there are many people in Indonesia, and also over Countries, who need those kind of products. Especially for those who are suffers from chemical sensitivities.

These people are in needs, but they don't know where to buy. They don't have sufficient information regarding Organic, Green and Healthy products and services.

Education, Institution and Marketplace

To connect these two parties: Those who produce and Those who in needs, we need to have some place where these two could meet and get to know each other well. That's why this passage need to have an issue of:

  • Educational, not only for Consumers but also for Producers for their quality
  • Institution to help Farmers and Producers to produce more organic, more nature, and get better result within their products and services, e.g: the best package material and design.
  • Marketplace for these qualified farmers and producers, where the consumers can rely on.


One Place to Start With

I have manage to gather friends from variety backgrounds and disciplines in a community named: Komunitas Organik Indonesia (KOI) or Indonesia Organic Community. www.KomunitasOrganikIndonesia.org

What is organic not the products, neither the certificate, but the mind and heart of the people. The people who produce and the people who consume them.

The funding that our community needs is about Rp. 10 Billion, or equivalent to US$ 1 Million to get start with our place for Educational, Institution and Marketplace, or what we call the Gerai Hijau (Gerai: Place to meet, display and trade. Hijau: Green. So it Gerai Hijau means Green / EcoFriendly Place for Meet).

Our community also has already established a legal entity, and we chose Cooperative (Koperasi) for this matter. So we are in legal institution, as we have a commitment to achieve our dream.

This Cooperative named Koperasi Produk Sehat Indonesia (Cooperative of Indonesian Healthy Products) abbrev KOPSI which will manage the fund that we will collect, to built the Gerai Hijau.


Gerai Hijau

In this Gerai Hijau, the farmers and producers of Organic, Green & Healthy Products can meet their consumers. Gerai Hijau will be the place for:

  1. Workshop of Organic, Green & Healthy movement
  2. Mini Seminar and Scheduled Talkshow
  3. Entrepreneurship Training Center for Producers and Producers to be
  4. Consultation Class for Organic, Green and Healthy issues
  5. Marketplace for Farmers, Group of Farmers, Artisans, Local Producers, from all over Indonesia.
The goal for the fund is to getting start to built this ideal shape of Gerai Hijau and placed in ideal location in Jakarta area.
If we can't reach the entire goal, the form of Gerai Hijau and the location will be altered to lower level, which can be cheaper and easier to get.


Green Impact

With this Gerai Hijau, the community will be able to promote and show to the people of Indonesia and also to the world that there are so many varieties of products, very wide range, and coming from numerous farmers and producers.

When the marketplace run well, so the farmers will grow the organic more, and the producers will produce more. And by that time, the environment will getting better and better. 

This green cycle will happen and Indonesia with a huge land of agriculture will donate more fresh oxygen to the world atmosphere. Start with our tiny movement here.

Our community has already succeeded to manage 3 times Expos of Organic, Green and Healthy, from 2011 to 2013, which gathered of about 120 Farmers, Group of Farmers, Small-Medium Enterprise from all over Indonesia.

The name of the Expo is as it is: Organic, Green & Healthy Expo of Indonesia. www.oghexpo.com

OGH Expo I, 2011

OGH Expo II, 2012

OGH Expo III, 2013

Now there are about 120 registered SME members and more than 8.000 individual members of the Community


    Risks & Challenges

    What the Community will face in this projects is about the place for Gerai Hijau to be located. As people in Indonesia still are looking for the more strategic location to come. While the strategic means price.

    These are our steps to overcome these challenges:

    1. Find the best location coming from our networks, to get the best ventures out of it. It can be a donation, a contribution, or the least is to rent with a low price.
    2. Get the lowest price yet the best design, which coming from the community network as well, for the exterior and interior design.
    3. Start to hire qualified members who will work with their heart, not their pocket, to assure this project to come to success. The committees from our previous Expos can be the first clue and good referrals.
    4. Start filtering our producers members who track record are flawless so customers can rely on.
    5. Monitoring and evaluating every steps and achievements to this project.


    All Welcome to Our Dream

    KOI is a very open community which welcome everyone who are willing to get involve and get together to achieve our Green Dream. From the farms in Indonesia to the World!

    So we are very please for whoever to help us share our dream, support us with promoting this campaign and also to use this Indiegogo share tools.

    Thank you very much.

    Green Regards

    Christopher Emille Jayanata

story:
Short Summary

Dad was an only child. During WWII, he had an easy-out as far as the draft. He was also 16 years old. Out of a sense of patriotic duty, He talked his Mother, my Grandmother, into signing the papers so he could enlist in the Army Air Force. He served proudly, and was discharged honorably. 

 

Our Father has now reached the age of 87. He has Parkinson's disease and other ailments which will take him from us some time this year.

Caring for him in the home has been very draining on our finances and resources, and on us emotionally and socially.

Our Father worked hard his entire life. He did a decent job of raising five kids.  He married and stayed married to our Mother (Who passed away 7 years ago) for 51 years. He was active in our Boy Scouts troops, helped coach softball. And made really awful  puns.

Now he is bed ridden. It is harder and harder to get him up to use the comode next to his bed. His memory fails, but at times he can remember clearly things that happened 60 years ago, but not what he had for breakfast.

He needs 24/7 attention and care more and more as he slides into home base.

What We Need & What You Get

While medicare helps with quite a bit, and we have a Hospice helping us, there is still a huge financial, and emotional strain.

Myself and a sibling have been the care providers for Dad for the last few years. This has been very draining on us. While I am thankful for every day that I get to spend with Dad, I am also burned out and broke.

It is time for us to hire home health care assistants. Medicare does not cover this expense. And it IS an expense!

Dad's appetite fades away. But he loves his Ensure nutrition drink. He goes through several bottles a day, and that stuff is really expensive. But it is about all he will intake on some days. Chewing and getting food into his mouth is becoming a big issue.

I have a job that I have had to cut way back on so I can stay home and care for Dad. And now it looks like I will have to pay out more then I earn in order to hire some help.

 

We don't know how long Dad will last. I am sure it will be within this year that he passes. His desire is to stay here at home until the end.

more detail:

We have Hospice workers that come in a couple of times a week to take care of some hygienic tasks and to monitor his health. While these people are wonderful, and covered by his insurance, getting any other outside help is very expensive.

There are several programs we could use, but the co-pay on our part would be from $750 per month to $2,500 a month or more. Those programs would cover in-home assistants. (Basically baby sitters that are able to change adult diapers and do other work)

And there is also the option of us hiring "baby sitters" on our own, probably cheaper. But it is risky hiring strangers, even by referal. And trained, bonded, insured help is much much better.

 

But beyond the direct care for Dad, I also need a break. I would love to be able to take some short road trips. And I would love to be able to do my job on weekends, which is also a big part of my social life. I would love to be able to go play with my band, which has been sitting idle because of my duties at home.  I would like to go out dating and meeting people. I just need a break. I also need to fix my old junker of a car.

I know that many of you will be in this position in the future, or have been in this position already. 

I put $10,000 as a goal for this fund raiser, but really any amount will help. I am sure that when it is all totaled up, we will still come out in the hole.

 

The Impact

Being able to make Dad's last days as comfortable as possible would be a blessing. Letting Dad live these last weeks with dignity, and in his own home is his desire.

For us, his care-givers, to not have to worry, biting our fingernails and stressing out over bills and logistics and the every day chores of caring for an elderly parent would be a huge relief. And that is a relief that is passed on to dad as well.

We try so very hard to hide our frustrations and stress and depression from him. We do not want him to feel like a burden, or feel guilty. But he senses it, and it affects him.

This is an issue that almost all of us will face at some point in our lives. If you have been through it, then you know what a draining ordeal it can be. And you will appreciate what our struggle is.

If by some miracle there is money left over after Dad passes, we will use it to cover any other  debts or bills, and then donate the remainder to either the Hospice, or the Public library, which dad was a big supporter of. (Or possibly the Air Combat Museum which he also supported)

You will have our undying gratitude, and many thanks. I am a strong believer in "What comes around, goes around", and that it all comes back to you.

I just wish i could do so much better for my Father, who did so very well for me.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can you help?  Please share this on your Facebook, Twitter, blogspot, share a link on your website, annouce it on your radio show or at your next event, please help us spread the word.  We would love input and suggestions, please contact administrator.

If by some miracle there is money left over after Dad passes, we will use it to cover any other  debts or bills, and then donate the remainder to either the Hospice, or the Public library, which dad was a big supporter of. (Or possibly the Air Combat Museum which he also supported)
You will have our undying gratitude, and many thanks. I am a strong believer in "What comes around, goes around", and that it all comes back to you.
I just wish i could do so much better for my Father, who did so very well for me.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Can you help?  Please share this on your Facebook, Twitter, blogspot, share a link on your website, annouce it on your radio show or at your next event, please help us spread the word.  We would love input and suggestions, please contact administrator.

story:
Relentless Pursuit of Dreams

For little Bryr Walker, a 10-year-old motocross racer from the small country town of Emmett, Idaho, the grand dream of racing for the National Championship Title at Loretta Lynn's Ranch in Hurricane Mills, Tennessee seems just a tad bit out of reach.  With 9 State and Local Championship Titles, over 100 Wins, and a few broken bones, the struggle to reach Bryr's dream isn’t due to a lack of talent, determination, and motivation.  Rather, the struggle to reach greatness at the National Championships due to a lack of adequate funding is simply daunting!

Bryr certainly does have the skill and heart to go for the National Win, but he comes from a huge family in a tiny town.  One parent struggles to pay the bills, and the other is studying to become a nurse.  All of this adds up to the great need to seek support from good-hearted people who believe in the golden dreams of an innocent, young boy just starting to make his way in the big world.

The cost of motorcycles, maintenance and rebuilds, food, fuel costs, insurance, doctor bills that weren't covered by insurance, entry fees, uniforms, and many more necessary things is far too great for his family.  Asking Dad to take cash out of the meager family living funds and put it into motocross ... well, a child can’t achieve this on his own.

Sweet dreams are made of this.  Who are we to disagree?  We travel the world and the 7 seas.  Every boy wants to be somebody.

We always tell our children that they can achieve their dreams, and we as their parental support system, will fully support them.  Let’s support Bryr as his aunts and uncles!  Make this young child's dream come true!  Watch Bryr make it to the Nationals and achieve his dream!

Please take a moment to click on your favorite reward and give your Vote of Confidence for Bryr Walker!

story:
We are a group of medical volunteers trying to help a baby recover from a life challenging condition and we are trying to find way to do raise money required to help a baby recover from this condition. Baby destiny was born on  16/12/ 2017, In a few Months the parents realized that his head was enlarging but culturally believed that it was air that had accumulated and will be released if they used a warm cloth around his head daily. It’s by chance that a team of RHU Officials visited one of our health centers supported by Real health and that is the only health center where people can access free treatment in that area, this is where we met baby Destiny and told the mother that her baby had a condition called Hydrocephalus.

 

Hydrocephalus can be very serious, and even fatal, if left untreated. Fifty percent of those who fail to have their hydrocephalus treated will die. Those who are not treated and survive may have serious brain damage and physical disabilities. With treatment, hydrocephalus can be managed.

 

We recommended that she takes the baby for scans and test but she said she was aware she need to take the baby to the hospital but she was recommended to hospitals where she has to go with money (the money that she doesn’t have), and as friends we decided to run this campaign so that baby Destiny gets the help that he needs.

We have coordinated a team of surgeons and made appointments with the hospital were baby Destiny can be operated. We now seek your support to help us help baby destiny through all the required tests, and a surgical procedure to help him grow without disturbance.

 

Please help us help baby Destiny.

story:
I've posted a somewhat more sedate 16-minute app runthrough on Vimeo... :)

Please note: this IndieGogo campaign is a complement to the BackerSupport KickStarter campaign; the data I get from running this campaign will be used to implement full IndieGogo support into BackerSupport.

When I completed my first KickStarter campaign, raising over $150k from several thousand backers, I quickly realized that none of the commercially-available campaign fulfillment tools had anywhere near the capabilities I needed. So I decided to build my own backer management solution that I could tune to my own specific needs and that was easy to customize. After over 6 months of tweaking, the result was BackerSupport.

In a nutshell, BackerSupport addresses two basic problems every successful project faces: "keeping track of your backers and what you have to send them" and "sending out their stuff efficiently."

I was planning to simply make it available for people to use on my usual "pay me what you think it's worth" basis, but one of my backers had a crazy idea -- "Do a KickStarter for it!"

The idea of doing a crowdfunding campaign to support an App that supports crowdfunding campaigns struck me as so delightfully recursive that I simply couldn't resist -- I kept hearing this sound in my head and I knew the only way to get it to stop was to give in to the madness.

So what does BackerSupport do?

With BackerSupport you can:

  • Track and communicate with all your backers.
  • Define your product(s) and the rewards each product needs to deliver.
  • Easily import all your data from KickStarter, and automatically translate from the various backer reward levels to their associated products and rewards.
  • Automatically handle products with variations like size and color.
  • Keep your campaign running after your campaign terminates and accept new signups / addons via PayPal and other funding sources -- all you have to do is copy/paste the email and click a button!
  • Update backer information, products, deliverables, etc., quickly and easily.
  • Validate US addresses with the USPS automatically.
  • “Batch” product fulfillment to minimize shipping cost and optimize your workflow. In my project I have to keep track of 6 different items that have been ordered in 19 distinct combinations; BackerSupport handles this automatically.
  • Print mailing labels and/or export addresses to USPS Click-N-Ship (particularly handy for international shipments as it'll print labels with the customs form filled out!), Postage $aver (great for bulk mailing), UPS.com batch file upload or any other app you care to use.
  • Let your backers vote on things, and run STV elections (a real nerd-feature) to determine their preferences.
  • Generate lots of useful reports.
  • Flexibly export your data to other applications.
  • Localize and customize the interface in all sorts of ways -- you can rewrite everything in Klingon if you like.
  • Bake in your business logic with extensible scripting, even if you don't own a copy of FileMaker.
BackerSupport is built on top of FileMaker, a popular database construction system. You won't need to own a copy of FileMaker to run the final app, but if you do, you can quickly add a field or write a script to add a feature you need.

What's the Current Status of BackerSupport?

BackerSupport is up and running and I'm using it to manage a $200k project (2750 backers in 45 countries, 3156 unshipped items) that will enter the Hell of Shipping in late August. If you have a copy of FileMaker Pro 13, you can download the current Alpha-test version and/or the manual (PDF) and play with it. You can get a 30 day FileMaker trial here. The current Alpha version requires FileMaker, but the final version will also be available as a standalone app for both Mac and Windows.

The main things I need to work on to get BackerSupport completed are:

  • Better testing of KickStarter import translation of rewards with variations. I have a pretty flexible system but it may need to be expanded a bit.
  • Support for other Crowdfunding platforms; again, I need example files.
  • Adding features that will be useful for projects that do not have physical rewards.
  • User Interface improvements.
  • More abstraction/customization options so that project managers can adapt it to their needs without needing to buy FileMaker. 
  • Rewrite the STV voting tools so they integrate with Google Docs and are in general easier to use.
  • Add support for more payment systems.

Aiming Low

The goal for this campaign is set to the minimum, and for a good reason. BackerSupport is 95% completed and I'm going to release it to the entire crowdfunding community sometime in the Fall come what may. The real goal of this project is to raise awareness, get some help with the alpha and beta-testing, and get feedback from the community about useful enhancements to the app.

The 99% vs. the 1%

Any funds remaining after the postcards are sent out will be allocated to adding bonus features to the app. I will solicit nominations from the backers for these ideas, and everyone will get to vote on which ones I implement; every $50 in excess budget will buy an hour of my time that I would not otherwise spend on the app.

I will run the STV election two ways, democratically (1 backer 1 vote) and plutocratically (1 dollar 1 vote), and then implement the most popular ideas, alternating between the democratic and plutocratic lists. Needless to say, this will let me more completely test BackerSupport's STV integration!

I look forward to your comments and suggestions about improving BackerSupport, and hope that you will find it useful in managing your projects!

story:
Hello Beautiful Friends!

I recently (as of 4 hours ago on Wednsday July 23, 2014 at 7:54pm when I am writing this!!!) received the most wonderful news. I have been accepted into the amazing Kripalu Center for Yoga and Health 200 Hour Teacher Certification Program. 

This is how I feel - I am overjoyed!!!!!

 The only caveat – it starts in 5 days and the basic costs, including training, materials, and transportation work out to over $4300!

Kripalu is a place near and dear to my heart, as it is in a way the foundation to my yoga journey. I come from a spiritual family and have always been drawn to practices that integrate the body, mind, and soul, but I did not begin practicing yoga regularly until high school. I attended Monument Mountain Regional High School and was fortunate to be part of a Kripalu Yoga collaboration in which we were able to practice yoga instead of gym class. To this day, almost 8 years later, I still have the course materials and practice the flows and breathing exercises we learned regularly. My yoga practice has progressed immensely, and I can now do amazing asanas like this - 

and this - 

!!!!!

I want my yoga practice and students in the future to be filled with love and self-awareness, and I believe that I can achieve this as a Kripalu Yoga Teacher. This training is about much more than the certification for me. I am so excited to see how this experience will shape the rest of my life and shape me as a being, and I hope to carry everything I learn deep within my body and share it with the world (YOU!). I hope to be able to bring everyone around me, especially those that may not normally be exposed to it, a piece of my joy and experience. I know for a fact that this practice can brighten lives and elucidate thoughts, ideas, and futures, and I truly believe the skills I learn will allow me to bring others to this realization.

In the past five years, I have managed to circumnavigate the world, get myself through a degree in biology with a concentration in health care, 3 study abroad programs, 4 internships, full time employment, and 19 countries. I am ready for the next step in this crazy adventure that is my life, I only need a little help to get there.

Peace, Love, and Namaste,

Sandra

What I need & What I can offer you!

So here is the deal! I am attending this program no matter what. If I don’t manage to do it starting on Sunday, my acceptance is valid for one year and the next program is October 19–November 14, 2014. It is an investment in my life and hopefully will be in yours too! As I mentioned before, the full cost of the program works out to over $4300 – here is a little break down:

Tuition - $2,675

Commuter Fee (covers 3 meals a day and facility use- $55/day for 26 days)- $1430

Transportation, Books, and Equipment- $300 - $400

Total: $4,405 - $4,505

I will be staying at my wonderful momma’s house to offset the cost of accommodation. If I raise anything above the campaign goal, the money will go towards funding community yoga classes once my training is completed.

Now, from experience, I (and everyone else I know), LOVES rewards.

Check out my rewards in the right hand column or below!

If you see something you don’t like or think of something else you might want, feel free to send me a message or email and let me know if there is anything I can offer in exchange for your support! I would love to help you help me. I know that it may not be feasible for you to contribute financially, but I would be forever thankful if you could consider sharing the link to my campaign in any social network that you are part of so others can contribute!

$1USD – Good Karma, love, advice, and gratitude. I will forever send positive energy your way.

$5USD – Thank you Post Card from the Glorious Berkshires

Good Karma, love, advice, and gratitude. I will forever send positive energy your way.

I will send you a beautiful post card while I am at Kripalu to tell you about my experience and thank you for your support.

$10USD – Breathing Exercises

Good Karma, love, advice, and gratitude. I will forever send positive energy your way. You will receive a post card while I am at Kripalu, as well as personalized advice session in which we can review different breathing techniques for any situation you might encounter.

$25USD – 10 Minute Guided Meditation

All of the above, as well as a an mp3 of a 10 minute guided meditation that you can do at home, before bed, at work, or any time you need a break from the world.

$50USD – Yoga Pose of Your Choice.

All of the above, as well as a personalized advice and coaching session to help you achieve your dream yogi pose (safely of course).

$75USD – I will make you food :)

All of the above, and a meal made with love from yours truly. (Obviously only for local folk, although I could be persuaded to bake cookies or brownies and send them in the mail)

$100USD – 1- hour Skype or In Person private yoga class.

You will receive all of the above, plus a personal yoga class! Time and date to be decided by us, invite a friend or two if you’d like!

$250USD – 3 private yoga sessions.

All of the above, as well as three additional yoga sessions for you and your friends. Time and date to be decided by us.

$500USD- Name your prize!

So what will I get out of all of this?

I was born with the overwhelming need to share my emotions, energy, ideas, and learning with the world. I want to help others create an experience that will lead them to a more empowering life. I have already started researching how to go about teaching community classes and this is another step in the process of becoming a health and wellness advisor. My body and mind require activity, stimulation, and I can’t think of a better way to nourish my body than practicing and teaching yoga, wellness, and nutrition to others that may need the same sort of release and realization. I want to inspire.

If you have no munnies to share…

If you are unable to contribute financially, send your love and positive vibes my way. Please get the word out. Share this with your friends, family, coworkers. Use the Indiegogo share tools or simply copy and paste everywhere and anywhere your heart desires!

Thank you! I love you!



"There is one great truth on this planet: whoever you are, or whatever it is that you do, when you really want something, it's because that desire originated in the soul of the universe.... The soul of the world is nourished by people's happiness...When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.”

Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

story:
Hello! my name's Corinne, I'm 14 and I'v decided to cut my hair off to help someone with cancer. Nearly all my life I've had long hair and it is a huge part of my identity and the routine of tying my hair up, curling or straightening it and buns will be no longer after the chop. 

Most people with cancer go through hair loss and can find it difficult to be in public without attracting attention. I'm donating my hair to be created into a hair piece for a cancer patient so that they can smile while being in the gloomiest chapter of their lives.

I've also asked for donations from you which I will be giving straight to the cancer council. If this cancer exists then so does the cure and with your donation researchers can find it and save millions of lives!

How your money will help :)

The couple of dollars your giving will be going towards saving lives, the cancer council began 53 years ago raising awareness on cancer, since then it has been funding researchers and teaching children how best to prevent cancer (i.e skin cancer) but most cancers are nearly totally unavoidable these days. Cancer council is Australia's most trusted organisation to prevent, detect and treat cancer so you know that they are serious about finding a cure.
I've put in a few perks and depending what you donate you will go into the raffle to win the prize! I'm sorry to say but only people over 18 can receive the alcoholic drinks but if you're under age check to see if you're parents enjoy the drink because they're going cheap!

Cancers Impact

Some facts about cancers impact:
An estimated 124,910 new cases of cancer will be diagnosed in Australia this year.
1 in 2 Australian men and 1 in 3 Australian women will be diagnosed with cancer
Cancer accounts for about 3 in 10 deaths in Australia.
The survival rate for many common cancers has increased by 30 per cent in the past two decades.
The most common cancers in Australia (excluding non-melanoma skin cancer) are prostate, colorectal (bowel), breast, melanoma and lung cancer. These five cancers account for over 60% of all cancers diagnosed in Australia
Cancer costs more than $3.8 billion in direct health system costs.
$378 million was spent on cancer research in 2000-01, 22% of all health research expenditure in Australia.  
If you've experienced cancer yourself or even through a family member or friends you know how hard it is on everyone and the change it can create in your life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money to spend their are other ways you can help out

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign and cancer. An easy way to do that is to share this on facebook

You can find out when your local relay for life is on and join a team or volunteer!

You could do a fun-run so many possabilites

It's easy!
story_txt: Hello! my name's Corinne, I'm 14 and I'v decided to cut my hair off to help someone with cancer. Nearly all my life I've had long hair and it is a huge part of my identity and the routine of tying my hair up, curling or straightening it and buns will be no longer after the chop. Most people with cancer go through hair loss and can find it difficult to be in public without attracting attention. I'm donating my hair to be created into a hair piece for a cancer patient so that they can smile while being in the gloomiest chapter of their lives.I've also asked for donations from you which I will be giving straight to the cancer council. If this cancer exists then so does the cure and with your donation researchers can find it and save millions of lives!How your money will help :)The couple of dollars your giving will be going towards saving lives, the cancer council began 53 years ago raising awareness on cancer, since then it has been funding researchers and teaching children how best to prevent cancer (i.e skin cancer) but most cancers are nearly totally unavoidable these days. story:
Hi, my name is Bonnie and I am the proud "Nuke" Momma of my only son who is serving his country on a submarine currently stationed at Naval Base Guam. He and his wife are expecting their first child in 2013 and I will be a first-time grandmother!
 
Before you read any further about my cause and why I am asking for you to consider helping me, please take the time to read some of the other more in-need and worthy causes at https://www.indiegogo.com  before you decide if you want to help me. I am not dying, or currently at risk of dying. Although, my "silent" illness is very debilitating and less understood, and it does have severe effects on my quality of life, there are others who most certainly need and deserve your help more than I do. With that said, let me tell you about my situation...
 
I have several serious health issues which basically have left me home-bound. I suffer from agoraphobia, chronic clinical depression, panic disorder and a respiratory condition called Reactive Airways Dysfunction Syndrome. If you consider all these health issues rolled up into one big clump you get a person who is afraid to step out their front door, attend family functions, go grocery shopping or any activity away from home, especially around strangers. I can't work and depend on SS disability to live.
 
So, why do I need you to help me? Well, I want to fly to Guam to be with my son who I haven't seen in a year since he was last home. I want to be there when his first child is born in March. I am currently in therapy to help me work through the daunting obstacles my illnesses present in making a 17 hour flight from Florida to Guam with two layovers for a total trip time of 20+ hours. That means I will be surrounded by strangers and in close quarters on Jets for hours and hours. I will need to be sedated and require special seating because of my disabilities. Being a widow living off of SS disability, I can't afford the cost of making a round trip to Guam and back. I want to be there with my son so fiercely when his first child is born that I am empowered with determination to over come my issues and demons.
 
So, that is my human condition. The constant darkness of depression and irrational fears of agoraphobia makes life a daily struggle. My respiratory illness is complex and any smoke or fumes can trigger a serious bronchial episode, but I am willing to risk the proverbial lion's den, spend hours heavily sedated in what to me are the most nightmarish conditions so I can witness the birth of my first grandchild and hug my son.
 
I need financial help to take this trip to Guam. Maybe you would like to help me. I hope so. This Mom would be so appreciative of any donation. xoxoxo

story:
Short Summary

My name is Yayne (like Shiny with a Y). On December 10th I had major surgery. For years I have had fibroid tumors. Fibroid tumors are non cancerous tumors that affect a large percentage of women. For most women, fibroids do not cause problems. Unfortunately, I am not most women. I have so many fibroids that I am in constant pain. I also suffer from excessive bleeding and have had several trips to the ER due to blood loss.
I have lost the one thing that most women take for granted to fibroid tumors, my uterus. I had to do it to save my life. I feel as if I have lost a part of me that defines me as a woman. I can never have children. Even more pressing is that I don’t know if I will be able to keep my home after this surgery.
I work for just above minimum wage. Currently 75% of my income goes just to my rent. I work for a small yoga studio. I am also a stand up comedienne and writer and I do not get medical leave pay. I have no idea if I will be getting temporary disability as I recover because I have been told that I will not hear back from SDI for 6 weeks. My recovery time is six weeks and I won’t be able to rest and recover because I don’t know if I will be able pay my rent. The stress of being homeless is all I can think about.
I need to be able to pay my rent, pay for my aging dog's medication and buy food as I recover from this necessary surgery.

What We Need  

I need money to pay my rent and buy food as I recover from surgery.

The Impact

If I can't pay my rent as I recover, I will be homeless and desolate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
We (Kelsey, Maki, and Tracy) are three nursing students hoping to make a small difference to St. Albert's. We will be volunteering at the small mission hospital during summer 2013 and want to bring much needed medical supplies with us. Your support is greatly needed in order to help us purchase the supplies and medical equipment. St. Albert's is important to us because it services a remote area of Zimbabwe. If the hospital didn't exist, people would endure long travel to access health care. We are trying to raise $3,000 in order to supply the hospital with essential supplies such as gloves and suture material. 

St Albert’s Mission Hospital is a 140-bed rural facility located near Centenary, Mashonaland Central Province, Zimbabwe. It is the only hospital in the district serving over 115,000 people including those from bordering towns in Mozambique. Without St. Albert’s, people seeking health care would have to travel far distances (four hours to several days).

 

A village on the escarpment near St. Albert’s Mission Hospital

 

St. Albert’s consists of about a dozen buildings like this one, connected by covered walkways. It also includes a rehabilitation unit, a male, female, and children’s ward, a maternity unit, neonatal unit, a small staff ward, a septic and an aseptic surgical theater, an out-patient care area, a pharmacy and kitchen, and a home-based care program.

Other social services provided by St. Albert’s and its home-based care team
  • Information on HIV/AIDS and other sexually transmitted infections in schools, rural communities and farm resettlement areas.
  • Support for widows, single mothers, orphan-headed families and grandmothers raising orphans. Support can include food, school fees, uniforms, and seeds and fertilizer.
  • Orphan care. The hospital pays the fees and expenses for several hundred orphans to keep them in school.
  • Establishing peer groups for youth in and out of school.
  • Helps families organize income-generating projects.

Any donation amount is appreciated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people can’t contribute, but everyone can help!

  • Ask friends/family to give a gift to this fundraiser as your Birthday/Holiday/New Years gift
  • Post this on your Facebook or Twitter accounts.
  • The ideas are endless so let us know what you are thinking!

story:
Hello my name is Luke Magnuson. I am a 24yo gay male who lives at my mother house with his boyfriend. All the mental abuse in the past. The stress has gotten to the point that i can not even leave the house or goto work. I am asking for help to get us into a studio apartment and try to get my life going again.
 
I am not really expecting to reach my goal at all. Im just hoping that when i recieve the money i will be able to get out of here and hire a moving truck to take our stuff to a new place to live.
 
I am hoping that if i succeed in this then i will be able to move on with life and join the workforce. As I said i can not leave the house because my anxiety sores through the roof. Without her my life will be able to be more bright and hopefully have a successful future ahead for me.

FEEL FREE TO SHARE MY STORY ANY LITTLE BIT HELPS!!
