story:
Hi

I'm a disabled trans student and activist who desperately needs an electric wheelchair.


My disability

In 2003 (aged 8) I developed rheumatic fever, a rare disease that becomes a permanent chronic pain condition when left untreated. As I was not correctly diagnosed until 2010, I have been left permanently disabled.


My living situation

Earlier this year (March) I became homeless due to many reasons including coming out as transgender. Now living with flatmates, I am living without all the support I had at home including DLA and having a live-in carer (previously my mum).

Now that winter has arrived, my chronic pain has gotten worse to the point of immobility. My flatmates help me out with day-to-day tasks, but I cannot afford carers. DLA (which potentially covers carers) takes months to process, and I am in the middle of getting the necessary paperwork together. I am in overdraft on two accounts and the student loan I receive after Christmas will barely cover rent and bills.


Being threatened with suspension by UCL

I only have a manual wheelchair which my flatmates/friends/girlfriend push me in. However, I start university at 9am three time a week, and I cannot propel myself due to my hands/wrists being in too much pain.

Due to homelessness, related mental health issues and physical disability I have missed enough university classes to be warned of barring and/or suspension. Unless my attendance is full-time from now on, UCL has told me that I won't be able to complete my first year (no matter my grades) and will have to leave.

I live on my student loans, and I desperately want to keep studying at UCL.


My DSA Assessment and SFE

My DSA assessment from 2013 SPECIFICALLY recommends an electric wheelchair so that I can attend university. However, Student Finance England have REFUSED to fund one. The appeals process takes weeks, and my appeal last year was rejected (although I had a legal aid-funded lawyer who was ableist).



I NOW DO NOT HAVE THE FUNDS OR PHYSICAL ABILITY OR TIME TO SUE SFE.


Summary

An electric wheelchair would change my life: I'd be able to go anywhere on my own, not miss university or doctors' appointments, and be able to live independently whilst I get my life back on track.

Please consider donating.

story:
TOXIC BLACK MOLD RELIEF FUND   (Mold & Mould)
It is my belief that the people have a right to know what's killing them. According to one doctor ten thousand people per year just die. They drop dead, they die in their sleep, their hearts just stop for no apparent reason.

Through years of study, I believe I know why.

Hundreds of thousands of people in countries all around the world die every year because of toxic black mold poisoning, and yet most people are completely unaware of it. Wrong diagnosis and lack of proper attention are the main culprits and because of my own devastating experience, I feel compelled to do something about it.

To quote one of our sources: "It is estimated that over 500,000 people in America die each year because of toxic black mold."

Mold content in the world is massively on the rise and people are going to see a major change and a rise in the Mycotoxin sector of the medical industry itself to deal with mold and mold related illnesses. Mold affects our health, it kills people, plants, and animals. It consumes almost anything and yet it is one of the most misunderstood biological functions in the world.

Because of a severe lack of awareness and treatment, the problem with mold continues to grow on a global scale. As I stated earlier, I feel compelled to do something about it, and this campaign to raise funds is my call to action.

Hi, my name is Drew. My life has been completely changed because of mold and I am launching a new career in the nonprofit and medical studies industry to help save lives and to improve the quality of life for those who have been devastated by sickness and death as a result of mold.

There are currently no "full time" nonprofits specifically designated to mold. There are some part time and in very little capacity, and those only address certain issues because of a lack of knowledge, experience, and information. I have the experience in both business and mold sickness to launch a nonprofit dedicated to breathing life into a relatively new and unknown industry.

This fund raising campaign is to get the program started, and together with dedication and proper funding, we will make a difference.

THE GOAL

We are raising funds of fifty thousand dollars to start a nonprofit organization to help families and individuals who have had their lives altered by the devastating effects of mold poisoning. To help people with the recovery process of; regaining their health, getting their lives back together, and bringing a wide form of education to the public, government, and to medical organizations to deal with Toxic Black Mold Poisoning. We will offer health solutions, diet and exorcise routines to help recover damaged bodies, general and advanced education, and data to the medical community, with counseling for housing and career alternatives.

WHAT WE WILL DO  ( People / Homes / Education / Community )

We will provide people affected by mold with nutrients and health related supplies to help begin the recovery process of bodily functions. These include foods, drinks, doctor approved supplements, along with a list of these things and what they do. We sit down with the victims of mold sickness and poisoning and their doctors and share the health information and education concerning the recovery process. These sessions will be made into video to further streamline and bring greater efficiency to the healing process.

We will evaluate housing problems to determine if they can be repaired or are they classified as "Walk away". We will search for, implement, and encourage housing assistance from local municipalities and organizations. We will also seek out alternative and emergency housing for victims.

We will compile a database of mold related information that will become a staple for the medical industry to use as a reference for treating mold sickness. This information will include; timelines, various nutrients found to have an affect on the healing process, progress reports, conclusions, and be made available to all industries that experience mold problems.

Although we will not be creating a new product requiring government approval, we will be seeking standard Material Data Safety Sheets (MSDS) to be issued to those industries in regards to mold. In addition, we are seeking cooperation with, federal, state, and local Environmental Health Services (EHS), and encouraging Community Environmental Health Assessment (CEHA) groups get involved as well. All of these under the direction of the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

Our goal is to help people regain their lives and create a full spectrum community awareness program that will become a household name.

ABOUT MOLD

Mold is a fungus / spore that grow in the form of multicellular filaments called hyphae. Molds pose a hazard to human and animal health when they are consumed following the growth of certain mold species in stored food. Some species produce toxic secondary metabolites, collectively termed mycotoxins.

The term "toxic mold" refers to molds that produce mycotoxins. In the world of science "black mold" is referred to as:  Stachybotrys



Mycotoxicosis is the term used for poisoning associated with exposures to mycotoxins. The symptoms of mycotoxicosis depend on the type of mycotoxin; the concentration and length of exposure; as well as age, health, and sex of the exposed individual. The synergistic effects associated with several other factors such as genetics, diet, and interactions with other toxins have been poorly studied. Therefore it is possible that vitamin deficiency, caloric deprivation, alcohol abuse, and infectious disease status can all have compounded effects with mycotoxins.

In turn, mycotoxins (Mold) have the potential for both acute and chronic health effects via ingestion, skin contact, and inhalation.

-------
Mold is an environmental hazard and often regarded as an environmental disaster on a very small scale. We think of environmental disasters as refuse dumping and chemical spills, but the fact is, mold is everywhere and causes devastating disasters on a smaller scale, yet devastates lives and kills countless thousands every year. Mold has only one goal; to consume and digest everything it can.

HEALTH EFFECTS

Molds are common in household and workplace dust, however, when mold spores are present in large quantities, they present a health hazard to humans and animals, causing allergic reactions and respiratory problems. The symptoms of mold poisoning can be debilitating and the long lasting affect can bring a persons life to its lowest point of existence. *Studies show that exposure to high levels of mycotoxins lead to neurological problems and in some cases death.

*Studies - There are actually only a few. We need multiple detailed studies.

SYMPTOMS OF MOLD POISONING  (Typical of most people)

Muscle pain, cramps, burning, unusual shooting (ice pick-like) pains, headaches, fatigue, weakness, flu-like symptoms, fever, chills, shortness of breath, coughing, abdominal pain, diarrhea, chronic sinusitis, sore throat, burning eyes, red eyes, sensitivity to light, difficulty with thought processes, memory loss, loss of concentration, confusion, disorientation, “brain fog”, dizziness, balance problems, metallic taste in mouth, numbness and tingling, temperature regulation problems, excessive thirst and urination, rash, mylar flush (face flushing), chest pains, Increased infections, the sensation that you are going to pass out, panic attacks, tremors, attention deficit disorder, vision problems, anxiety, depression, difficulty losing weight, ringing in the ears, hearing loss, chronic fatigue, nose bleeds and pulmonary hemorrhaging (stachybotrys), fibromyalgia, multiple sclerosis like symptoms, cancer, joint pains, irregular heart beat, heart attack, can’t get a deep breath, difficulty handling any kind of stress, mood swings, irritability, sensitivity to sound, nausea, vomiting, new food allergies, jaundice (yellowing of the skin or eyes), poor insight into illness, stomach ulcers, and more.

Sadly, there is a story behind each of these items listed. Imagine having almost ALL of the symptoms listed above... What would you do?

MY STORY

I'm Drew. I lost (Almost) everything, including my health because of mold. I was a business developer in Las Vegas. I worked in information services, real estate, IT and Technical services, telecommunications, technical writing, a consultant to all of the above and more.

This was my duplex apartment in 2007.

A few pictures inside.

I was making a living but I was not paying attention to my home environment. Through various circumstances the mold grew over a period of three years. You have heard the analogy of putting a frog in a pan of boiling water and it will jump right out, but if you put a frog in a pan of cold water and bring it slowly up to boiling, the frog will boil to death. This is because it slowly adapts to its environment.

If I had walked into my home for the first time and smelled mold I would have known there was something wrong. But in fact I lived in it and the mold killed off my ability to smell. It killed off my senses and brain functions that allow me to protect myself and make good decisions. It was like a biological war going on inside me. My body was the battle field and my mind was the PTSD aftermath.

I was getting sicker, thinking it was some other form of illness. Cancer, diabetes, heart disease, etc... It wasn’t until a friend of mine called me crying telling me, “...you’ve got to get out of there now!” I had already lost a lot of my brain function leaving me totally dysfunctional and disoriented. I could barely do anything, or get anything done. My beautiful duplex apartment was a mess. I had chest pains and I had made two trips to the emergency room because I felt my heart stopping, then it would just start up again. It was scary and very painful. I never experienced anything like it in my life.

I could only sleep for one hour at a time. Then I would be up walking around for fifteen minutes, then go back to sleep for another hour. My diet was massively thrown off and I gained sixty-five pounds. And I had lost interest in everything.

I also lived in a constant state of dreaming, or a “dream world” for three years. From 2009 to 2012 I literally felt like I was dreaming and was about to wake up. This is a very disturbing way to live each day, Being in a state of "dream" all the time means major memory problems and a host of other nightmares as well. I moved to New Mexico to live with my father to recover. The move from Nevada to New Mexico in October 2010 is like a memory from a dream I had twenty years ago.

They say if you survive mold poisoning the typical recovery time is three to five years. I am in my fifth year and I am slowly recovering but I live with tremendous bodily pain and disorientation every day, I shake all the time, can’t focus on much. Thank goodness for my team.

The good news? I’m still alive. But as I rebuild my life instead of returning to the career I had, I feel driven from the impact of mold poisoning to help others who suffer from the same experience. My hope is to see that no one ever suffer from this deadly nightmare.

Much of my physical and bodily functions are damaged, and much of my technical abilities and in learning new things has diminished greatly, I cannot play chess anymore. However, I have a new found appreciation of art. I have always been a tech-know-geek and never gave art much attention, but now I enjoy visiting art galleries. The next big thing for me and my life is this new nonprofit and bringing relief to people who need help.

HELP IS ON THE WAY

Currently the only way I can fulfill my goal of helping others is to start a nonprofit organization to bring a professional approach to this problem. Fortunately I have several people standing by waiting to serve on the board and several friends willing to donate money to the nonprofit. The key right now is to get this campaign underway to raise the money needed to get things started. We are brand new. That's what we're shooting for with this campaign... that shot in the arm we need to get the nonprofit started.

THE SUICIDES MUST COME TO AN END

A staggering number of people suffering from mold poisoning commit suicide after months or even years of suffering and then being turned down by social security disability. There are no official studies to back this up. It's all stories from families and friends of people who have committed suicide. This is very sad.

One of my goals is to reduce the number of people who just give up. After what I suffered over the past five years, I can see why people kill themselves. From 2009 to 2011, I myself thought it would be better to be dead then to suffer with this nightmare. Every day there was an unmistakable feeling running through my body and my mind that I wasn’t going to make it. I felt like the end was near. I wasn't depressed, I was horribly sick. My mom would call and encouraged me to hang in there and gave me the positive affirmation of, “you’re going to live”. Everyday I would say to myself, “I’m going to live, I’m going to live...” I have dedicated the rest of my life to help people live through this tragedy. For those of you thinking about suicide... Please don't. There are so many things to live for. You just have to find them. My goal is to help you find them.

LACK OF DIAGNOSIS

Mold poisoning is a devastating sickness. While other diseases such as cancer, or heart disease have a diagnosis, mold poisoning is still relatively unknown. For many people who live in dryer climates, there is no immediate diagnosis. People suffer horribly while waiting for doctors to figure out what’s wrong. In the past five years I have seen 18 doctors all of whom are completely baffled as to what could be wrong because doctors are simply not trained for this type of illness, especially in the Southwest.

"Doctors have told me straight up on several occasions that they know little or nothing about mold."

Some doctors just give up. One physician after;  all the tests, my failing health, severe pain, evidence of record, evidence of pictures, and solid evidence of moldy items bagged in a storage locker, this doctor concluded that it was all in my head. Are you kidding me? In my opinion this person clearly should not have been practicing medicine. At the very least she should have referred me out to a specialist, but she declared me mentally ill because she was more worried about concluding her diagnosis rather then seeking a cure. I never went back to see her again. My new doctor rolled his eyes when I told him that story, then he instantly referred me to a specialist. It's an ongoing procedure. I will ad more to my written experience as the nonprofit progresses.

MOLD WILL CHANGE YOUR EMOTIONAL LIFE

In my recovery I want to be encouraged and excited, but mold poisoning has caused me to become desensitized. In February 2009 my best friend died and I could not cry. I felt completely devastated over his death and yet I could not shed a single tear because of desensitization. Mold has often been referred to as “Hell on earth” and I now completely understand why. Once again thank goodness for the people helping me with this project.

THE TEAM

I have assembled a small team to help with this funding project and many of the same people are interested in helping with the nonprofit itself, so it is up to me to show them that raising funds to get this massive project started is not only possible, but how it will make an affective change in the lives of people who have had their lives destroyed by mold.

We are also happy to announce that we are enlisting the help of fiscal sponsorship from an established nonprofit that specializes in helping new nonprofits grow and maintain their position of success in the nonprofit community. According to attorneys I have spoken too about nonprofits, this is the preferred way to get a nonprofit off the ground. This is all coming together better than I ever expected.

I have chosen to start this project in the nonprofit friendly state of New Mexico. There is remarkable help with nonprofits in New Mexico, and branching out across the country in 2015 will be that much easier.

STAGES OF THE CAMPAIGNS / NONPROFIT

Stage One:  The establishment of a nonprofit organization a as base of operation to begin helping families and individuals affected by mold. The $50,000 raised in this campaign will get the process' underway.

We already have families and individuals on the list to receive assistance from our efforts. The list is growing and we wait with great anticipation to help them.

Note:  Although this nonprofit is starting out in the United States, our goal is to reach the four corners of the earth to help out in countries everywhere where people have been affected by mold.

Stage Two:  Begin the process of raising money to support the nonprofit, which will give aid to people who have been devastated by mold, and begin an awareness campaign that will open the eyes of doctors, the government, and the people, as to how deadly and destructive mold poisoning can be.

Stage Three:  Create a foundation for the purpose of treatment and education. This is a long term goal in development that may take some time to be realized based on how much and how fast money can be raised. If enough money is donated we will do this sooner.

We will be publishing written and digital educational materials that could potentially become part of medical schools’ curriculum. Once the program is underwritten by doctors and approved by FDA, our long term goal is to see the knowledge and education of the subject of mold to become common knowledge among doctors and in medical universities in every country.

-------

It should be noted that because of a diverse back ground in technology, former experience with solar energy, and a passion for humanity, all the stages of growth experienced with this new nonprofit will be kept in strict accordance with green technologies. We will perform as any well structured business, but our preference of running a business will always support sustainable futures.

PERKS

This is our very first campaign, and being that money is scarce, we have no real, tangible perks that would sit in a trophy case or anything like that, however...

We are pleased to say that a generous and anonymous individual has offered to donate a small number of papers written on various subjects that range from facts and commentaries to educational, from medical information to controversial social issues, and things you always wanted to know or wondered about.

These papers are one hundred percent (100%) ours in ownership to give away. They are not copyrighted but we have the original treatise work. (We own the originals). They are perks to anyone who would enjoy reading some interesting material. Many of these papers can be used to spark new threads on web pages looking for material to talk about or debate, or just be informative.

The number of written materials and other perks will increase with future campaigns.

Please note:  It is our deepest hope and sincerity that people will donate based on wanting to see this horrible medical condition and environmental hazard brought to light, addressed properly, and brought under control. We want to bring the help needed for all who have been affected. The perks will get better as we acquire the money to do so.

THE END GAME

This nonprofit will save lives, create jobs, and ad medical and biological data to the world's current teachings. It will protect the sustainable future of people’s lives and their general health, along with plants, animals, the businesses we go to everyday, and the homes we live in.

CLOSING

The reason mold is killing so many people and doctors know so little about it is because the pharmaceutical community has no safe pill you can take for mold related problems. The current anti-fungal drugs available on the market today cause considerable damage to the liver. Die of mold poisoning or die of liver disease... Not a desirable choice, but there are options.

If the end of my life has to come at the expense of devastation from mold, I’m going to make sure that people know how and why, and I’m going to do everything I can to help educate the public and the medical community, and help those who have suffered similar fates. I am driven to succeed because I know from experience that I can make a difference.... I got this!

We are raising $50,000 to get this nonprofit started. After the successful campaigns I’ve seen here for medical conditions, I know the good people of this planet want to see severe medical problems like this wiped out. We will make it happen. Invest in the cure and stand back and watch us go to work.

Join me in this passionate journey to bring relief to those who have suffered so much.

JOIN US THIS HOLIDAY SEASON TO BRING AN END TO MOLD SICKNESS.

Thank you for your time and consideration.


                             MAY BLESSINGS AND HAPPINESS FILL YOUR LIFE

.
story_txt:
TOXIC BLACK MOLD RELIEF FUND   (Mold & Mould)It is my belief that the people have a right to know what's killing them. According to one doctor ten thousand people per year just die. They drop dead, they die in their sleep, their hearts just stop for no apparent reason.Through years of study, I believe I know why.Hundreds of thousands of people in countries all around the world die every year because of toxic black mold poisoning, and yet most people are completely unaware of it. Wrong diagnosis and lack of proper attention are the main culprits and because of my own devastating experience, I feel compelled to do something about it.To quote one of our sources: "It is estimated that over 500,000 people in America die each year because of toxic black mold."Mold content in the world is massively on the rise and people are going to see a major change and a rise in the Mycotoxin sector of the medical industry itself to deal with mold and mold related illnesses. Mold affects our health, it kills people, plants, and animals. It consumes almost anything and yet it is one of the most misunderstood biological functions in the world.Because of a severe lack of awareness and treatment, the problem with mold continues to grow on a global scale. As I stated earlier, I feel compelled to do something about it, and this campaign to raise funds is my call to action.Hi, my name is Drew. My life has been completely changed because of mold and I am launching a new career in the nonprofit and medical studies industry to help save lives and to improve the quality of life for those who have been devastated by sickness and death as a result of mold.There are currently no "full time" nonprofits specifically designated to mold. There are some part time and in very little capacity, and those only address certain issues because of a lack of knowledge, experience, and information. I have the experience in both business and mold sickness to launch a nonprofit dedicated to breathing life into a relatively new and unknown industry. This fund raising campaign is to get the program started, and together with dedication and proper funding, we will make a difference.THE GOALWe are raising funds of fifty thousand dollars to start a nonprofit organization to help families and individuals who have had their lives altered by the devastating effects of mold poisoning. To help people with the recovery process of; regaining their health, getting their lives back together, and bringing a wide form of education to the public, government, and to medical organizations to deal with Toxic Black Mold Poisoning. We will offer health solutions, diet and exorcise routines to help recover damaged bodies, general and advanced education, and data to the medical community, with counseling for housing and career alternatives.WHAT WE WILL DO  ( People / Homes / Education / Community )We will provide people affected by mold with nutrients and health related supplies to help begin the recovery process of bodily functions. These include foods, drinks, doctor approved supplements, along with a list of these things and what they do. We sit down with the victims of mold sickness and poisoning and their doctors and share the health information and education concerning the recovery process. These sessions will be made into video to further streamline and bring greater efficiency to the healing process.We will evaluate housing problems to determine if they can be repaired or are they classified as "Walk away". We will search for, implement, and encourage housing assistance from local municipalities and organizations. We will also seek out alternative and emergency housing for victims.We will compile a database of mold related information that will become a staple for the medical industry to use as a reference for treating mold sickness. This information will include; timelines, various nutrients found to have an affect on the healing process, progress reports, conclusions, and be made available to all industries that experience mold problems.Although we will not be creating a new product requiring government approval, we will be seeking standard Material Data Safety Sheets (MSDS) to be issued to those industries in regards to mold. In addition, we are seeking cooperation with, federal, state, and local Environmental Health Services (EHS), and encouraging Community Environmental Health Assessment (CEHA) groups get involved as well. All of these under the direction of the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).Our goal is to help people regain their lives and create a full spectrum community awareness program that will become a household name.ABOUT MOLDMold is a fungus / spore that grow in the form of multicellular filaments called hyphae. Molds pose a hazard to human and animal health when they are consumed following the growth of certain mold species in stored food. Some species produce toxic secondary metabolites, collectively termed mycotoxins.The term "toxic mold" refers to molds that produce mycotoxins. In the world of science "black mold" is referred to as:  StachybotrysMycotoxicosis is the term used for poisoning associated with exposures to mycotoxins. The symptoms of mycotoxicosis depend on the type of mycotoxin; the concentration and length of exposure; as well as age, health, and sex of the exposed individual. The synergistic effects associated with several other factors such as genetics, diet, and interactions with other toxins have been poorly studied. Therefore it is possible that vitamin deficiency, caloric deprivation, alcohol abuse, and infectious disease status can all have compounded effects with mycotoxins.In turn, mycotoxins (Mold) have the potential for both acute and chronic health effects via ingestion, skin contact, and inhalation.-------Mold is an environmental hazard and often regarded as an environmental disaster on a very small scale. We think of environmental disasters as refuse dumping and chemical spills, but the fact is, mold is everywhere and causes devastating disasters on a smaller scale, yet devastates lives and kills countless thousands every year. Mold has only one goal; to consume and digest everything it can.HEALTH EFFECTSMolds are common in household and workplace dust, however, when mold spores are present in large quantities, they present a health hazard to humans and animals, causing allergic reactions and respiratory problems. The symptoms of mold poisoning can be debilitating and the long lasting affect can bring a persons life to its lowest point of existence. *Studies show that exposure to high levels of mycotoxins lead to neurological problems and in some cases death.*Studies - There are actually only a few. We need multiple detailed studies.SYMPTOMS OF MOLD POISONING  (Typical of most people)Muscle pain, cramps, burning, unusual shooting (ice pick-like) pains, headaches, fatigue, weakness, flu-like symptoms, fever, chills, shortness of breath, coughing, abdominal pain, diarrhea, chronic sinusitis, sore throat, burning eyes, red eyes, sensitivity to light, difficulty with thought processes, memory loss, loss of concentration, confusion, disorientation, “brain fog”, dizziness, balance problems, metallic taste in mouth, numbness and tingling, temperature regulation problems, excessive thirst and urination, rash, mylar flush (face flushing), chest pains, Increased infections, the sensation that you are going to pass out, panic attacks, tremors, attention deficit disorder, vision problems, anxiety, depression, difficulty losing weight, ringing in the ears, hearing loss, chronic fatigue, nose bleeds and pulmonary hemorrhaging (stachybotrys), fibromyalgia, multiple sclerosis like symptoms, cancer, joint pains, irregular heart beat, heart attack, can’t get a deep breath, difficulty handling any kind of stress, mood swings, irritability, sensitivity to sound, nausea, vomiting, new food allergies, jaundice (yellowing of the skin or eyes), poor insight into illness, stomach ulcers, and more.Sadly, there is a story behind each of these items listed. Imagine having almost ALL of the symptoms listed above... What would you do?MY STORYI'm Drew. I lost (Almost) everything, including my health because of mold. I was a business developer in Las Vegas. I worked in information services, real estate, IT and Technical services, telecommunications, technical writing, a consultant to all of the above and more.This was my duplex apartment in 2007.A few pictures inside.I was making a living but I was not paying attention to my home environment. Through various circumstances the mold grew over a period of three years. You have heard the analogy of putting a frog in a pan of boiling water and it will jump right out, but if you put a frog in a pan of cold water and bring it slowly up to boiling, the frog will boil to death. This is because it slowly adapts to its environment.If I had walked into my home for the first time and smelled mold I would have known there was something wrong. But in fact I lived in it and the mold killed off my ability to smell. It killed off my senses and brain functions that allow me to protect myself and make good decisions. It was like a biological war going on inside me. My body was the battle field and my mind was the PTSD aftermath.I was getting sicker, thinking it was some other form of illness. Cancer, diabetes, heart disease, etc... It wasn’t until a friend of mine called me crying telling me, “...you’ve got to get out of there now!” I had already lost a lot of my brain function leaving me totally dysfunctional and disoriented. I could barely do anything, or get anything done. My beautiful duplex apartment was a mess. I had chest pains and I had made two trips to the emergency room because I felt my heart stopping, then it would just start up again. It was scary and very painful. I never experienced anything like it in my life.I could only sleep for one hour at a time. Then I would be up walking around for fifteen minutes, then go back to sleep for another hour. My diet was massively thrown off and I gained sixty-five pounds. And I had lost interest in everything.I also lived in a constant state of dreaming, or a “dream world” for three years. From 2009 to 2012 I literally felt like I was dreaming and was about to wake up. This is a very disturbing way to live each day, Being in a state of "dream" all the time means major memory problems and a host of other nightmares as well. I moved to New Mexico to live with my father to recover. The move from Nevada to New Mexico in October 2010 is like a memory from a dream I had twenty years ago.They say if you survive mold poisoning the typical recovery time is three to five years. I am in my fifth year and I am slowly recovering but I live with tremendous bodily pain and disorientation every day, I shake all the time, can’t focus on much. Thank goodness for my team.The good news? I’m still alive. But as I rebuild my life instead of returning to the career I had, I feel driven from the impact of mold poisoning to help others who suffer from the same experience. My hope is to see that no one ever suffer from this deadly nightmare.Much of my physical and bodily functions are damaged, and much of my technical abilities and in learning new things has diminished greatly, I cannot play chess anymore. However, I have a new found appreciation of art. I have always been a tech-know-geek and never gave art much attention, but now I enjoy visiting art galleries. The next big thing for me and my life is this new nonprofit and bringing relief to people who need help.HELP IS ON THE WAYCurrently the only way I can fulfill my goal of helping others is to start a nonprofit organization to bring a professional approach to this problem. Fortunately I have several people standing by waiting to serve on the board and several friends willing to donate money to the nonprofit. The key right now is to get this campaign underway to raise the money needed to get things started. We are brand new. That's what we're shooting for with this campaign... that shot in the arm we need to get the nonprofit started.THE SUICIDES MUST COME TO AN ENDA staggering number of people suffering from mold poisoning commit suicide after months or even years of suffering and then being turned down by social security disability. There are no official studies to back this up. It's all stories from families and friends of people who have committed suicide. This is very sad.One of my goals is to reduce the number of people who just give up. After what I suffered over the past five years, I can see why people kill themselves. Please don't. There are so many things to live for. You just have to find them. My goal is to help you find them.LACK OF DIAGNOSISMold poisoning is a devastating sickness. story:
My experience in traveling throughout Peru has been extraordinary.  While journeying to the High Andes mountains, visiting the sacred valley and working with the plant spirit medicines of the jungle I met amazing people who transformed the way I look at the world.  To give back to the communities from which I've received so much, I am working with Vanishing Cultures and Waves for Water on various projects to bring clean parasite-free water to the Q'ero villages and communities living along the Amazon.

These are my partners:

Vanishing Cultures Foundation, Inc. was created to support the indigenous people of Peru by preserving their spiritual lineage and supporting their economic development.
Vanishing Cultures’ approach to fulfilling its mission is one that provides funding, practical advice and hands on support for each village project. We assist but never interrupt. We support but do not interfere. The village is involved in every step of the process. The input of the village is critical to our mission.

Waves for Water was created with one mission in mind. Get clean water to every single person who needs it.  We provide clean water solutions worldwide through ongoing projects and volunteer programs.

  • Our goal is to give 100 families water filters!!!  And to do this we need your help!
  • Clean water is a basic human right.  Every family needs water to live and thrive.
  • The goal of $10,000 will cover the cost of the water filters and work to defray the costs of the Water Couriers - the volunteers who travel to the region and teach the families how to install the filters and get them up and running. 
  • Even if we don't reach our goal - all the money raised will help the families in the Amazon to move towards a clean water environment.
If you live in the Seattle area and can't donate for the filters - you can still help!
We are always looking for school supplies and toiletries to bring to the Amazon.
Things like: pencils, pens, erasers, markers, rulers, scissors, and hygienic supplies like toothbrushes, combs, lip balm, etc.
And if you still want to help further - PLEASE SHARE this campaign with everyone you know!  The more people who know about our project the better.
I am passionate about helping this region of the world get access to the clean water that is everyone's right. Thank you for your assistance in making this a possibility.

story:
Biodynamic CranioSacral Therapy is a gentle hands-on therapy that is able to provide relief for people living with ailments of all kinds. A skilled CranioSacral therapist has the ability to facilitate lasting healing in a person, be it physical, mental, emotional or spiritual. In other parts of the world, (eg:  the UK and Australia) CranioSacral Therapy has taken root and is popular.

In North America we are at the beginning of this wave. There are only a small handful of registered and licensed CranioSacral therapists that live and work in Vancouver. To date, there has never been a Centre opened with numerous therapists that offer CranioSacral Therapy sessions to the public. Three months ago we changed that.

We brought together a small group of dedicated and caring CranioSacral practitioners and began our vision of building a clinic in the heart of the West End of Vancouver. Our intention was to make this miraculous therapy easily accessible and available to members of the public in a warm and welcoming environment. We assembled a team to help build our vision.

Click here for more information on our team

We began to work on a business plan that would bring in our start-up financing.  Working alongside Small Business B.C., we took the traditional route of applying for a small business bank loan. It was a long process and while it was underway, we began the physical construction of our clinic. Before we knew it, we had a general contractor, a plumber, an electrician, a printer and a web designer all join in, offering their services IN GOOD FAITH! It took 2 months and we had successfully constructed a beautiful, welcoming CranioSacral Therapy clinic in the heart of the West End of Vancouver.

On July 26th, 2013 we opened our doors to the public.  We gave a total of 10 cranial sessions in our two little treatment rooms and people were thrilled with the results… we were buzzing with pride and happiness

Two weeks later, after passing through four different levels of approval, we learned that our bank loan application had not met with the final green light.  Which meant we did not have the money to pay all the contractors that had already finished working for us!  Life went on and people kept showing up in our clinic wanting to learn about our services and we grew busier doing what we do best – giving CranioSacral Therapy sessions to people who wanted to heal!

With the support of a small handful of generous friends and family, we were able to meet our most basic financial obligations and give small token payments to all of our contractors.  The bulk of their invoices, however, still remained unpaid.  Which is what brings us here!  To this Indiegogo crowd funding website…


We are reaching out to everyone out there who recognizes the value of CranioSacral Therapy and is as excited as we are to see it being finally being introduced in Western Canada.  We are also appealing to all those who value relationships and are equally as touched as we are to recognize and honour the amazing trust that was given to us by the people who worked long and hard before there was even any money available to pay them for their efforts. That is loyalty. And we will never forget it!

We would like to raise the funds to pay all the wonderful people who helped us to physically build the clinic and also those who have been assisting us in an administrative support capacity since our doors have been open for business. 

We are looking to raise $55,500.00.

As part of our gratitude and thanks to everyone who contributes (over a certain amount), we will be offering complimentary CranioSacral Therapy Sessions and, in some cases, signed prints of the wonderful images (see below) captured by Vancouver stone balancer and artist, Kent Avery.  We have outlined a more clearly defined chart to help people understand what they are entitled to. We thank you in advance for caring and contributing to a truly worthy fundraising cause and treatment therapy.




We are of the firm belief that this therapy is going to go “viral” in the not too distant future… we see no other way! Once you have experienced a Biodynamic CranioSacral Therapy session in the Caring Souls Cranio Clinic, you too will likely be of the same belief!

If we are fortunate enough to raise more than our goal we will use the extra funds to help subsidize those who wish to heal but do not have access to the funding that will allow them to do so. We have a long term goal to put our energies into working to make this therapy available to everyone regardless of their financial status. To date there is progress being made. ICBC honours our services and so too do some extended health benefit programs but it is still a therapy that requires individuals to pay for their sessions, if not in full at least in part. Any and all generosity will be gratefully received and will go a long way to help spread healing on this planet!  That is something we would all like to see - and will surely all benefit from!  :)


With the warmest regards and sincerest thanks,

The dedicated team of The Caring Souls Cranio Clinic


For more information on The Caring Souls Cranio Clinic, please visit:

www.caringsoulscranio.com
story_txt: Biodynamic CranioSacral Therapy is a gentle hands-on therapy that is able to provide relief for people living with ailments of all kinds. A skilled CranioSacral therapist has the ability to facilitate lasting healing in a person, be it physical, mental, emotional or spiritual. In other parts of the world, (eg:  the UK and Australia) CranioSacral Therapy has taken root and is popular.In North America we are at the beginning of this wave. There are only a small handful of registered and licensed CranioSacral therapists that live and work in Vancouver. To date, there has never been a Centre opened with numerous therapists that offer CranioSacral Therapy sessions to the public. Three months ago we changed that.We brought together a small group of dedicated and caring CranioSacral practitioners and began our vision of building a clinic in the heart of the West End of Vancouver. Our intention was to make this miraculous therapy easily accessible and available to members of the public in a warm and welcoming environment. We assembled a team to help build our vision.Click here for more information on our teamWe began to work on a business plan that would bring in our start-up financing.  Working alongside Small Business B.C., we took the traditional route of applying for a small business bank loan. It was a long process and while it was underway, we began the physical construction of our clinic. Before we knew it, we had a general contractor, a plumber, an electrician, a printer and a web designer all join in, offering their services IN GOOD FAITH! It took 2 months and we had successfully constructed a beautiful, welcoming CranioSacral Therapy clinic in the heart of the West End of Vancouver.On July 26th, 2013 we opened our doors to the public.  We gave a total of 10 cranial sessions in our two little treatment rooms and people were thrilled with the results… we were buzzing with pride and happinessTwo weeks later, after passing through four different levels of approval, we learned that our bank loan application had not met with the final green light.  Which meant we did not have the money to pay all the contractors that had already finished working for us!  Life went on and people kept showing up in our clinic wanting to learn about our services and we grew busier doing what we do best – giving CranioSacral Therapy sessions to people who wanted to heal!With the support of a small handful of generous friends and family, we were able to meet our most basic financial obligations and give small token payments to all of our contractors.  The bulk of their invoices, however, still remained unpaid.  Which is what brings us here!  To this Indiegogo crowd funding website…We are reaching out to everyone out there who recognizes the value of CranioSacral Therapy and is as excited as we are to see it being finally being introduced in Western Canada.  We are also appealing to all those who value relationships and are equally as touched as we are to recognize and honour the amazing trust that was given to us by the people who worked long and hard before there was even any money available to pay them for their efforts. And we will never forget it!We would like to raise the funds to pay all the wonderful people who helped us to physically build the clinic and also those who have been assisting us in an administrative support capacity since our doors have been open for business. We are looking to raise $55,500.00.As part of our gratitude and thanks to everyone who contributes (over a certain amount), we will be offering complimentary CranioSacral Therapy Sessions and, in some cases, signed prints of the wonderful images (see below) captured by Vancouver stone balancer and artist, Kent Avery.  We have outlined a more clearly defined chart to help people understand what they are entitled to. ICBC honours our services and so too do some extended health benefit programs but it is still a therapy that requires individuals to pay for their sessions, if not in full at least in part. Any and all generosity will be gratefully received and will go a long way to help spread healing on this planet!  That is something we would all like to see - and will surely all benefit from!  :)With the warmest regards and sincerest thanks,The dedicated team of The Caring Souls Cranio ClinicFor more information on The Caring Souls Cranio Clinic, please visit:www.caringsoulscranio.com

story:
Summary

I am the director of World Health Equity, an organization seeking to improve health equity for vulnerable populations. This July, I was in Sierra Leone managing our maternal health program in conjunction with international and national partners. Along with our team, I visited health providers at over 100 facilities. One day, I suddenly came down with a fever. Within 3 hours, I went from energetically training maternal health responders to shaking and shivering violently.  I was weak and my body ached to an excruciating degree. My symptoms were typical of malaria. However, my work put me at significantly higher risk of contracting Ebola. 

The two days it took for my blood tests to process seemed to last a lifetime. As my condition grew worse and I started to vomit, I realized that what scared me was not that I could be awaiting death. Surprisingly I could accept that possibility. What drove me to feel helpless and terrified, was the knowledge that if I had Ebola, that I would die without saying good-bye to my loved ones. Diseases cost lives every second of every day. For me, what is so ruthless about Ebola in particular, is the way it forces victims to anticipate death, be ostracized and feared, and remain void of human touch and personal connection. My test results came back negative for Ebola. I had never been happier to have Malaria and to feel the physical touch of family and friends through illness.

Today, close to 6,000 people have been infected with Ebola and over half of them have died. If these numbers appear small and not significant, surely Centers for Disease Control (CDC) worst-case scenario projections of as high as 1.4 million Ebola cases by January 2015 will put things into perspective. What these projections suggest, is that in two and a half short months, populations the size of Philadelphia, Barcelona, Johannesburg could face isolated death from Ebola. Today, weak health systems in West Africa continue to crumble. Restrictions to travel and trade are already causing prices for basic necessities to spike dramatically. Schools and universities have been closed for months. Tomorrow, this outbreak could become endemic and may literally annihilate countries! Unless we wake up and act, that is. 


What We Need & What You Get

World Health Equity aims to raise $12,500, which will go toward supplying personal protective equipment (PPE) for health workers at the 100 facilities covered in our maternal health program. Health workers who are risking their lives every day to deliver quality care for patients require protective gear such as gloves, masks and body suits to prevent infection with Ebola. 
Our goal is to raise $125 per facility. $100 will fund a full body suit and supply of chlorine, $20 will fund health provider training on proper PPE and $5 will cover the cost of fundraising on Indiegogo.  
If our 12,500 goal is not reached, World Health Equity will supply this greatly needed protective equipment to health centers in most need as identified by the Sierra Leone Ministry of Health. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Just as meaningful would be making noise about this campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out! We have 60 days! Help us make them count!

story:
Short Summary

Hello friends,

It has come to my attention that a friend of mine has come upon a temporary hardship.

Tiffany lives in Waukesha, Wisconsin, and has found herself in a terrible bind.

She has a home which will be available on October 17, but due to mitigating circumstances with the place she had been living at until her new home became available (where all her funding is currently tied up), she has found herself homeless.

Tiffany is a hard working a decent young woman trying to make her way, and humbly declined my offer for assistance in this campaign. However, I cannot bear to see anyone homeless. I feel it is a scourge for our country which is completely unnecessary. So I have taken it upon myself to try helping her out of this temporary setback, and I can use your help. Tiffany can really use our help. And believe me, she is the type to certainly pay it forward.

Five dollars, ten dollars, whatever you can help with. It all adds up.

I sincerely appreciate whatever you can do, and I am sure she will be so relieved if I can reach this funding goal, and surprise her with this kind gesture ...   

I would like to get this to near my goal. Any and all funds raised will be given to Tiffany to help her immediately.

The Impact

Tiffany will be able to bridge the gap in her current situation, and be able to find a housing solution until she can finally get into her new place on October 17. 


Risks & Challenges

 Tiffany is currently essentially homeless. Her family is unable to provide any type of financial assistance unfortunately, and do not live in the area, and since she is somewhat new to the area, she doesn't have the safety net of trusted friends in the area who could help.

Timing is of the essence. She needs a place now. There is a shelter, Hebron House, but its constantly full to my knowledge. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially, and would like to, please share this with your friends :)

Thank you so very much my wonderful friends on whatever you can do ..

story:
SHOP NOW

www.dylninspired.com

CAMPAIGN GOAL

Through Indiegogo, we want to introduce to the world our unique and highly advanced living activewear collection. With your support, we’ll be able to fund the first production run of our DYLN InspiredTM apparel and continue researching the effect of our VitaPearlTM fabric on the human body.

OUR VISION

We developed a line of activewear from specially constructed fabric carrying cutting edge nano-technology that improves the body’s performance and healing capabilities. Though this, we hope to make it simpler for you to live as your fullest and most powerful potential.

WHO IS DYLN INSPIREDTM?

A wellness-oriented community of entrepreneurs, yogins, designers, and health-enthusiasts, the company aims to spread the feeling of optimal health and superior performance. We live DYLN Inspired because we each pursue true health and deep personal fulfillment.

THE ESSENTIAL DIFFERENCE

DYLN InspiredTM living activewear makes you feel good and perform excellently on a deep cellular level.

CUTTING EDGE TECHNOLOGY: VITAPEARLTM FABRIC

We engineered this fabric to deliver unparalleled health-enhancing capabilities. The embedded Bio-Photonic nano-technology emits far-infrared, which increases micro-circulation and oxygenation. The fabric also generates negative ions, which help charge the body’s cells.

PERFORMANCE 

The fabric was built for sustainable health and sustainable performance, so we made sure it includes the moisture management, support, and stretch you expect from clothes designed for practice.

UNIQUE COMFORT

To produce a luxuriously soft texture, we embedded authentic crushed pearls within the fabric.

ELEGANT DESIGN

DYLN Inspired Line of Tops

DYLN Inspired Line of Bottoms

DETAILS AND SIZING

We will send you product details, sizing information, and color options after your order is placed and the campaign has ended.

Among the benefits being researched of wearing the VitaPearl fabric are:

  • Improved micro-circulation
  • Increased muscular oxygenation
  • Quicker recovery from physical activity
  • Decreased muscle fatigue

Through Medical Thermal Imaging, also known as Thermography, we were able to perform preliminary tests on the effects of our living activewear on the human body. We did this by detecting inflammation and changes in microcirculation.

Each subject was scanned for a baseline measure and then re-scanned after sitting for 30 minutes wearing a DYLN InspiredTM tight and tank.

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

We have been working on building our technology and developing our first women’s active apparel collection for over two years. After having successfully produced our fabric and completed the development and preliminary testing of our line, we need your help to progress into full production.

THE FOUNDERS

Dorian Ayres

After struggling with a series of serious health challenges for a number of years, Dorian received his first taste of what it feels like to heal holistically from the inside out. The onset of this incredible sensation sparked a sudden and highly passionate search for a deeper understanding of the human body and such healing practices as yoga. Inspired to share this transformative feeling of self-healing, he made it his personal mission to bring this level of knowledge and health to as many people as possible.

David Walker

With a strong background in holistic medicine, David is the talent who made Bio-Photonic Technology possible. His knowledge and application of the natural healing sciences allowed him to design the efficacious VitaPearlTM fabric, as well as the VitaBeadsTM that enliven the DYLN Living Water Bottle.

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

We have worked tirelessly and diligently in setting a rock solid foundation to ensure we only create the highest quality product available. 

Over the last two years, we have built strong working relationships with our suppliers, manufacturers, quality control teams, logistic and fulfillment specialists, and many others in order to minimize any potential challenges, while also ensuring the resources to quickly and efficiently overcoming any issue that may arise. Our production partners manufacture for some of the top sports apparel brands in the world, and we are extremely confidant in the infrastructure we have put into place.  

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We stand firm on our commitment to successfully deliver superior quality products. In order to face the risks and challenges we need your help and funding to ensure that delays and unforeseen events can occur are effectively tackled. Throughout the campaign, we will continuously update our backers with our most recent progress.

How do I know these will fit?

Here is a size chart explaining which size if right for your body, complete with instructions for proper measurement. We will send you this information again with product details and color options in an email after you place your order and the campaign has ended.

HOW TO MEASURE

Accurate Measurement

Get fitted by a professional or at least have someone else measure you. If you measure yourself, stand in front of a mirror with good posture to make sure the tape measure is parallel to the floor.

Bust

Place the tape measure under your arms around the fullest part of your chest.

Waist

Your natural waist lies between your bottom ribs and hipbones. To measure, breathe deeply, relax your stomach, and lay the tape measure around your waist. Allow for 1/4" of slack.

Hip

To achieve the most accurate hip measurement, find the widest point of your hips and place the measuring tape around. The hipbone often isn't the widest point; it is one or two inches lower, where your bottom is its fullest.

What if I provide the wrong size?

We want to make sure you receive the right size so you can have the best fit possible. Please ensure you correctly fit yourself based of our instructions and select the appropriate size according to our size chart. If you receive your oder, and it is not the right size, please get in touch with us, and we will send you the right one!

How do I select size and color?

All you have to do is respond to an email we'll send once your order is placed and the campaign is over. See the question above for sizing information, and below for a sample of our color combinations.

Are there any special washing or care instructions?

To preserve the life of your garments, machine wash cold in gentle cycle with similar colors and air dry.  Do not bleach, do not iron, do not dry clean, do not tumble dry. 

I like many of the styles. Can I select multiple perks?

Of course! But in order to do so, you will have to contribute to your desired perks separately, since it is not possible to select multiple perks in one session.  If you want order higher volumes at once, please contact us, and we will do all we can to help.

Does the embedded technology wash out?

No. Our Bio-Photonic Nano-technology is embedded into our fabric and yarns, therefore it is part of the structure of the fabric and garment.

Do you ship to my country?

Yes! We ship to just about every country. Shipping within the US is free (except for retail packages), and if you live outside the US, please make sure to add $25 to your contribution.  

We LOVE DYLN Inspired and want to tell everyone. What can I do?

We would appreciate you emailing our Indiegogo page, igg.me/at/dyln, to any friends and family. You may also like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter, and from their you can share our link to your friends and followers.

story:
My Story


My name is Levi Wampler and I have been in love with the martial arts since I was a little kid.  Being a martial arts instructor was the first job I ever wanted to do but over the years my dream has been almost killed by adulthood and responsibilities.  I have been able to keep the dream somewhat alive by running a small part time class wherever I can find space to teach. I currently run a class out of a local gym but I am looking to expand into my own location.  My students need a school they can call home.  

I love training people in martial arts.  Martial arts training is a fun way to get into shape, learn fear management skills, willpower and discipline.  I want to help people in my local community find a fun way to do all of those things and to help them find the courage to follow their own dreams.  

Martial arts training is about more than just defending yourself, or fighting, it is a path of self discovery.  A discovery of the power our bodies and minds are capable of if we push ourselves.  Leading people to the limits of their abilities and then showing them how to dig down and surpass them is one of my greatest pleasures in life.  

I live to help people become stronger, more confident, better versions of themselves.


What I Need To Make It Happen


Starting a martial arts school doesn’t require very much capital since the main product is my knowledge and time but there are some expenses I will need help with initially.  


Fixed Expenses:


I need three months worth of these expenses to give me a cushion while I build my student base.  

Monthly Expenses:

Rent - $1000 a month  x 3 = $3000

Utilities - $200 x 3= $600

Marketing Consulting - $200 x 3 = $600


One Time Expenses:


These are expenses I will need to open the doors and attract new students.  I will need enough training equipment for 5 students, after that I will buy more equipment as I add more students.

Open House Advertising - $300

Insurance (yearly) - $450

Training Mats - $1,600

Signage - $500

Last months rent and Security Deposit for building - $2,000

Loaner Gloves and Equipment for new students - $100

Punching Bags - $800


Sub Total - 9,950



If I Miss The Goal


I teach my students there are often bumps in the road on the way to your goals. You should never think of these as failures, just setbacks.  They are a chance to show the world how badly you wanted to achieve your goal. If my project does not become fully funded I will work with the funds I receive to make the dream happen.  The building and advertising to get people in the door are my first priorities.  I can slowly purchase everything else I need as I add more students.


The Perks:


$10 White Belt

The White belt is your first and most important belt, everything you learn after white belt will build on this level.  

For White Belt Donations:

  1. You will receive a personal Thank You posted to your facebook page and mine letting the world know how much I appreciate your help.


$15  Orange Belt

The Orange belt is an important mile marker on your way to black belt.  You will begin sparring more and learning to use your techniques at full speed.

For Orange Belt Donations:

  1. You will receive a personal Thank You posted to your facebook page and mine letting the world know how much I appreciate your help.

  2. You will also receive a Thank You Card in the mail

  3. Plus, after the school is finished you will receive a picture of the school, so you can see what your money has built.


$25 Brown Belt


This is when you begin really training hard and you are beginning to become a force of nature.  

For Brown Belt Donations:

  1. All Previous Perks

  2. Plus, your name will be put on a donor wall which will be prominently displayed in my school so all my future students will know you made this school possible for them.


$50 Blue Belt


The Blue Belt is halfway to your black belt and if you live in the Carbondale, IL area this is an important level for you.  

For Blue Belt Donations:

  1. At this level you will  be signing up for unlimited classes at my new facility for one month.  Regular price for unlimited classes will be $80 per month once the school opens.

  2. You will also be listed as a founding member of my school on the donor wall.  

    .


$100 Black Belt


Originally a belt became black through years of hard training.  The sweat from training would stain the belt black, that doesn't happen now that we have washing machines and bleach.

For Black Belt Donations:

  1. You will be signing up for  TWO months of unlimited classes at my new facility.  Regular price for 2 months of unlimited classes will be $160 once the school opens.
  2. Plus, you will be locking in this rate for one year. 
  3. You will be listed as a founding member of my school on the donor wall.  

$1,000  Master Level


A master is judged not by his martial arts ability but by his ability to produce masters.  

For Master Level Donations:

  1. You will be signing up for unlimited classes for one year and locking in this reduced rate for life and you will be named as a founding member of my school.

  2. Plus, for this donation level I will name a martial arts move after you.  You will forever be immortalized as people learn to do the "Your Name Here" move.  You will also receive a video demonstrating how to do your signature move, and I will mail you a certificate naming you as an Honorary Master.  



$5,000 Ultimate Supreme Grand Master Ninja and All Around Cool Person

At this level you no longer worry about fighting or any other mortal humans problems.  You are now able to shoot lighting bolts from your eyes and turn your enemies into toads.  You command the elements of nature and bend them to your will.  

"There can only be one"

For Master Level Donations:

  1. You will receive unlimited classes at my facility for life. 
  2. You will be listed as a founding member on the donor wall.
  3. Plus, you and I will meet at Ultimate Fighting Championship 168 where I will act as your personal announcer for the fight or get you beer and nachos from the concession stand, your choice.  
  4. OR You can also substitute a UFC party at your place where I will bring the beer and nachos for you and 5 of your friends.

Your Impact

You will be helping me to not only live out my life long dream but you will be helping me to help others in my community become stronger, healthier, and more confident. These skills will help my students to find the strength to pursue their dreams too.   



Other Ways To Help


Please like, share, and email my story by clicking on the share tools on this page.  Even if you are unable to contribute with money you can share this with your friends to see if they would like to contribute.  The more people who see my story the more likely I will be able to fulfill my dream.


Thanks for reading, I appreciate your time.

story:
The idea of AQUA 100 came from the boring task of counting laps, mainly when you are training long distances in a 25 yards swimming pool. A traditional clock cannot be easily watched when you are swimming, so the AQUA 100 design was born to solve this problem.

More than counting laps, AQUA 100 allows you to monitor 8 different information:

You can enable or disable each one of the 8 functions above and switch from one to another with a simple movement. You can also configure AQUA 100 to switch from one enabled function to another automatically each stroke.  

AQUA 100 also records the most important information of your training and you can download it through the USB reader, the recorded information are :

  • Date 
  • Start Time 
  • Training time 
  • Downtime 
  • Average Stroke Rate (SR)
  • Average Distance per Stroke (DPS)
  • Number of stroke cycles 
  • Number of laps
  • Distance

Tech Spec

  • Battery: CR2450 3V 610mA.h
  • Autonomy : 600 hours of use (4 years if you swim 3 hours per week)
  • Memory: 1 Mb (More than 7000 training)
  • Download Interface: Infra Red
  • Display: 1.5 inches with Led Backlight
  • Waterproof: 5 meters
  • Motion control
  • Weigh with battery: 29 g (1 oz.)
  • Maximum external dimensions: 55x54x21mm (2.2"x2.1"x0.8") 

     Detailed Functions

    Motion Control

    AQUA 100 has only one button, it is used to turn it on, turn it off, enter in configuration mode and reset partial chronometer and distance. All other commands and configurations are done by motion detection, to switch from one enabled information to another, you rotate your wrist twice and quickly.

    If you want you can configure an automatic mode were the enabled info changes each stroke.

    To scroll options in configuration mode or set the clock time you rotate AQUA-100 to left or right to decrease or increase respectively.


    USB reader for PC Interface

    AQUA 100 allows you to download your training information into a PC through a USB reader. The reader is an infra-red to USB interface.  

    Holder

    The holder is a textile accessory used to hold AQUA 100 in the back of your hand, there are several challenges on its design, make it comfortable, generate minimum drag and be easy to wear. 

    The standard holder is black, but it will be available in different colors and you will be able to match your holder color with your swimsuit.



    Swimsuit options

    There are 9 swimsuit options for the $99 perk, all of them are high quality products designed by Fabiola Molina company and made by ACQUOS, a resistant and comfortable material. You can choose between 3 models (Sunkini, Swimsuit or men's suit) and 3 different print colors. We will contact you to know your preference.

           



    The Team

    Renato Pisani and Ivan Sant'Anna studied electronic engineer together and after graduated they worked in an american company where they start developing electronic devices for customers in 1999. In 2003 they open their own design house and help dozens of companies to develop their projects. Ivan and Renato love sports and outdoor activities as much as they love electronics, so in 2009 they launch their first product as an industry and start to produce navigation instruments for free flight pilots. 

    For the development of AQUA 100 Ivan and Renato had invited Fabiola Molina and Diogo Yabe, both professional swimmers with participation in Olympic games, to help define features, test and improve it.

    Fabio is an angel investor of the company, he is also swimmer, surfer and physical educator. He has joined the company when AQUA 100 was just an idea.

    Alessandro Casella is also an adventure lover and he is specialized in video production so he was invited to be part of the team not only for video production, but also to contribute with the campaign creation.

    AQUA 100 in the press
    VEJA is the Brazilian's weekly best seller magazine, they wrote an article about the promising startup companies where AQUA 100 was highlighted.

    Estado de S.Paulo is one of the best sellers daily newspaper in Brazil, this article was about startup companies that export their product abroad, and Tirante A - Adventure Instruments was highlighted as an example of success on this strategy. 

    Prototypes evolution

    The AQUA 100 evolution can be seen in the pictures below:

    The first idea was to use a negative blue and white display, the first test was done with a market LCD from a medical equipment to test the concept. After that we have done a tool to produce a customized LCD, it became nice, but we discovered this color combination was not good enough for underwater visualization, so, after a optical research we changed it for positive black and green.The under water view became perfect.   


    The cabinet was a huge challenge, it should be small, waterproof, rugged, with good hydrodynamic, so we have used a 3D software to design it, we have made 4 different prototypes in 3D printers until achieve the desired specs. After that we made a injection mold for mass production.    



    Hardware development is what we do better, the first prototype was done with a cropped PCB in order to test some concepts, after that we made the green one where the majority of the software was developed. The black PCB on the right is not the last one, there is a updated version in the same color


    The holder is an important part of the product, the challenges here were to create a part comfortable, easy to wear and generate minimum drag.



    As you can see, AQUA 100 has already achieve a full function prototype stage, it cabinet injection mold is already done, the customized display tool to produce it in large scale is ready and the hardware is 99% completed. Now we need your help to finish the holder design, finish some details in software algorithm and produce it in large scale. Every contribution, no matter how small, will help us build the community we need to bring AQUA 100 to market.

    Help us to make your swim smarter.

    Timeline

    Risk and challenges

    The concept of AQUA 100 was already proved, there are several working samples swimming for months, our main challenge is to bring it to a mass production. Yes there are some adjusts on firmware, hardware and the holder, but there is no big technological risk. 

    What if we don't reach the goal? Well, if we don't reach the goal the delivery time will expand a little, but we will finish the project and deliver the perks for sure.

story:
Thank You For Helping CTW.

If you’re reading this, then that means you’re considering a donation to CTW charity wrestling. Before we go any further - thank you. I’m grateful for your time and attention.

The cause of the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation is near to my heart, as I know several people who battle CF every day. It’s important that we fund the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. Over 30,000 Americans (most of them children) suffer from CF, but that amount of people is not enough to warrant federal funding on CF drug research.

In other words: if we don’t donate money to cystic fibrosis research, the research doesn't happen.

The indie pro wrestling community is eager to get involved and help slam cystic fibrosis to the mat - but we need your help to get started! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal of $2,500 will go directly towards these expenses:

  • Rental fee for an event hall/building that will hold 250-500 audience members
  • Essential fees (ring rental, audio/visual rentals, etc.)
  • Marketing and PR for the event (flyers, tickets, press costs)
  • NOTE: THE EVENT COORDINATORS ARE NOT TAKING ANY SALARY FROM YOUR DONATIONS.
We are offering some amazing rewards for your donations!
  • VIP and backstage tickets to the debut CTW event (in New Jersey)
  • Memorabilia & autographs from CTW's pro wrestlers
  • One-on-one Skype chats/video chat with a CTW wrestler
  • Personal thank you messages on CTW's website & videos

The Impact

CTW Charity Wrestling is honored and humbled to name the Greater New Jersey Chapter of the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation as its charity of choice for the 2015 wrestling season.

The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation is the world’s leader in the search for a cure for cystic fibrosis. Cystic fibrosis is a genetic disease that affects 30,000 children and adults in the United States (and 70,000 worldwide). CF is a life-threatening condition that primarily affects the lungs and digestive system.

As recently as the 1950s, very few children diagnosed with cystic fibrosis lived to the age of 5. Now, with the assistance of the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, more than 45% of those affected by CF are over the age of 18. By 2017, CFF hopes to bring a first-generation cystic fibrosis drug to the marketplace.

Why We Need Your Help

Since our goal is to raise money AND awareness through CTW pro wrestling events, corporate sponsors don't get a tax write-off for helping sponsor us. As a result, it's been a challenge finding a "big" sponsor for the debut event. I'm confident we'll get there, but in the meantime we need as much help as we can from the community.

I'm humbled you've taken the time to read this, and that you're considering a donation of any size. I care so deeply about cystic fibrosis research, and I thank you for your help.
